poeas: <entryFree id="n36782" type="main" key="Poeas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paeas</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n36782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Philoctetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1603" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1603</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36782.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeantĭădes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paeant-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Pœas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Philoctetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 313</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n36782.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeantĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paeant-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pœas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pœantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poeantia proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Philoctetes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: heros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 111</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Poeantius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poecile: <entryFree id="n36783" type="main" key="Poeci^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poecĭle</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poiki/lh</foreign> (variegated). <sense id="n36783.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The picture-gallery, a celebrated hall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portico in the market-place at Athens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in porticu, quae Poecile vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36783.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gallery in the Athenian style at the Tiburtine villa of the emperor Hadrian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poeeessa: <entryFree id="n36784" type="main" key="Poee_essa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeēessa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poih/essa</foreign>. <sense id="n36784.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient name of the island of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36784.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient town of Cea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poema: <entryFree id="n36785" type="greek" key="po^e_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n36785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> poëmatorum, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 114</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 14</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> usually poëmatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also poëmatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 5</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poi/hma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a composition in verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a poem</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. carmen): pars est parva poëma, proinde ut epistola quaevis. Illa poësis opus totum, ut tota Ilias una Est <foreign lang="greek">qe/sis</foreign>, annalesque Enni: atque istoc opus unum Est majus multo quam quod dixi ante poëma, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 428, 12 sq.</bibl>; cf.: poëma est <foreign lang="greek">le/cis eu)/ruqmos</foreign>, id est verba plura modice in quandam conjecta formam. Itaque etiam distichon epigrammation vocant poëma. Poësis est perpetuum argumentum e rhythmis, ut Ilias Homeri et Annales Ennii, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 428, 19 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata (opp. oratio),</quote> <trans><tr>poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>.—So of some verses of a poem: <cit><quote lang="la">o poëma tenerum et moratum atque molle!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a short poem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 16, 1</bibl></cit>. But this distinction is not observed even by Ennius, and poëma was the name in the class. period for every kind of poem: <cit><quote lang="la">latos per populos terrasque poëmata nostra clara cluebunt, Enn. ap. Prob. p. 1401 P. (Ann. v. 3 Vahl.): poëma facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma ad Caesarem quod composueram, incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecum condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 416</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma festivum, concinnum, elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si poëma loquens pictura est, pictura tacitum poëma debet esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 28, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridenda poëmata malo, quam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poematium: <entryFree id="n36786" type="greek" key="po^e_ma^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏēmătĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poihma/tion</foreign>, <sense id="n36786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">short poem</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poemenis: <entryFree id="n36787" type="main" key="Poeme^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poemĕnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poena: <entryFree id="n36788" type="greek" key="poena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poinh/, a)/poina</foreign>, quitmoney, fine; Lat. pūnio, poenitet</etym>, <sense id="n36788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indemnification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compensation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penalty</hi> (cf. mulcta). </sense><sense id="n36788.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: SI INIVRIAM FAXIT ALTERI VIGINTI QVINQVE AERIS POENAE SVNTO, Fragm. XII. Tab.: mi calido das sanguine poenas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 101 Vahl.); imitated by Virgil: tu tamen interea calido <cb n="POEN" /> mihi sanguine poenas Persolves amborum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 422</bibl> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas justas et debitas solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas poenas pendo temeritatis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae poenas aut morte aut exsilio dependere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas pro civibus suis capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id pro immolatis in foro Tarquiniensium Romanis poenae redditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis victi Poeni poenas sufferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: ob mortem alicujus poenas luere, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas pro aliquā re luere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 925" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 925</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 11, 2</bibl>: poenam dignam suo scelere suscipere, Cic. lmp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas a seditioso cive persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Fam. 1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas doloris sui ab aliquo petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Att. 1:16:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetere poenas ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Rosc. Am. 24:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afficere aliquem poenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Off. 2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā et poenā multare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Balb. 18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena falsarum litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Fl. 17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticentiae poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Off. 3:16:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas acquas irroget peccatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocrium delictorum poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: poena nummaria, <hi rend="ital">a fine</hi>, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 14, 2, 2; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:111" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36788.2" n="B" level="2"> Poena, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of punishment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vengeance;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: Poenae, <hi rend="ital">the goddesses of vengeance</hi>, sometimes identified by the poets with the Furiae: <cit><quote lang="la">o Poena, o Furia sociorum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva sororum Poena parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:796" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 796</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 25</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 695</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 390, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:147" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 147</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36788.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hardship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, etc. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">frugalitatem exigit philosophia, non poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantis vitae poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaenae pariendi poenis invalidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa poenarum patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrius qui nullum forte cecidit, dat poenas,</quote> <trans><tr>is in anguish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:279" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 279</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poenalis: <entryFree id="n36789" type="main" key="poena_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>poena</etym>, <sense id="n36789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penal</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the jurists): opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenalis aquae dirisque genitae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex lege poenali aquā et igne interdici,</quote> <trans><tr>by the penal law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:section=128" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:54" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">poenāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">men subject to punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer poenalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: inter haec horrenda et poenalissima, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly punishable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avar. 2, 10</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">poenālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by punishment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penalty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">reus poenaliter interibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poenarius: <entryFree id="n36790" type="main" key="poena_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO">7, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poeni: <entryFree id="n36791" type="main" key="Poeni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poeni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Phœnicians</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Carthaginians</hi> (descended from the Phœnicians): Poeni stipendia pendunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 269 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 278 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poeni foedifragi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenorum crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponuntque ferocia Poeni Corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 302</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:714" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 714</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:311" default="NO">17, 311</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian</hi>: Poenus plane est, <hi rend="ital">he is a true Carthaginian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">full of cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 113</bibl>.—Pregn., for <hi rend="ital">Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 77</bibl>.—Collectively: <cit><quote lang="la">si uterque Poenus Serviat uni,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Carthaginians in Africa and Spain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36791.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Punic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 3: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:338" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 155</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est nullus me hodie Poenus Poenior,</quote> <trans><tr>better versed in the Carthaginian tongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36791.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭ-cus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Poen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Punic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi> (the classical form): <cit><quote lang="la">CLASEIS. POENICAS OM(nes devicit), Inscr. Column. Rostr.: regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: bellum primum, secundum, tertium, Cic. <pb n="1391" /> <cb n="POET" /> Off. 1, 13, 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl>: fides, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bad faith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treachery</hi> (because the Romans considered the Carthaginians perfidious), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 108:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 108, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl> and 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4</bibl>, ext. 4; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>: Punicum malum, or simply <itype>Punicum, i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pomegranate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 11, 11, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl> et saep.: arbos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a pomegranate-tree</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 243: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36791.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">of the Phœnician color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple-red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">punicarum rostra columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">rostra psittaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: punico Lugubre mutavit sagum, Hor Epod. 9, 27.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭcē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Poen-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in the Punic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adibo hosce atque appellabo Punice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>in Punic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poenice: <entryFree id="n36792" type="main" key="Poeni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Poeni, B. <sense id="n36792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
poeniceus: <entryFree id="n36793" type="main" key="Poeni_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenīcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phoeniceus.</entryFree>
poenicus: <entryFree id="n36794" type="main" key="Poeni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Poeni, B.</entryFree>
poeninus: <entryFree id="n36795" type="main" key="Poeni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Penninus.</entryFree>
poenio: <entryFree id="n36796" type="main" key="poeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. punio <sense id="n36796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
poenitens: <entryFree id="n36797" type="main" key="poeni^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from poeniteo.</entryFree>
poenitenter: <entryFree id="n36798" type="main" key="poeni^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭtenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>poeniteo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. <sense id="n36798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
poenitentia: <entryFree id="n36799" type="main" key="poeni^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭtentĭa</orth>, v. paenitentia.</entryFree>
poeniteo: <entryFree id="n36800" type="main" key="poeni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭtĕo</orth>, v. paeniteo.</entryFree>
poenitio: <entryFree id="n36801" type="main" key="poeni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. punitio.</entryFree>
poenitudo: <entryFree id="n36802" type="main" key="poeni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭtūdo</orth>, v. paenitudo.</entryFree>
poenosus: <entryFree id="n36803" type="main" key="poeno^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poenŏsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>poena</etym>, <sense id="n36803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painful</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poenulus: <entryFree id="n36804" type="main" key="Poenu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Poeni</etym>, <sense id="n36804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Young Carthaginian</hi>, the title of a comedy of Plautus.</sense></entryFree>
poenus: <entryFree id="n36805" type="main" key="Poenus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Poeni.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36806" type="main" key="Poenus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Poeni, A.</entryFree>
poesis: <entryFree id="n36807" type="greek" key="po^e_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏēsis</orth> (pŏĕsis, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 52</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poi/hsis</foreign>. <sense id="n36807.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The art of composing poems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poesy</hi> (rarely so used), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36807.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut pictura, poësis erit: quae, si propius stes, Te capiat magis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anacreontis tota poësis est amatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poeta: <entryFree id="n36808" type="greek" key="po^e_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (POETES, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1163</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poihth/s</foreign>. <sense id="n36808.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec fallaciam Astutiorem ullus fecit poëta,</quote> <trans><tr>a contriver</tr>, <tr>trickster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu poëta es prorsus ad eam rem unicus,</quote> <trans><tr>you are just fit for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36808.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi> (class.; syn. vates): visus Homerus adesse poëta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl> (Ann. v. 6 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores et poëtae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versificator quam poëta melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictoribus atque poëtis Quidlibet audendi semper fuit aequa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expectes eadem a summo minimoque poëtā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex absolvit injuriarum eum, qui Lucilium poëtam in scenā nominatim laeserat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: unum (genus deorum) a poëtis traditum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
poetelius: <entryFree id="n36809" type="main" key="Poeteli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poetelĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Petelius,</quote> <trans><tr>a consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poetica: <entryFree id="n36810" type="main" key="po^e_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. poëticus, II.</entryFree>
poetice: <entryFree id="n36811" type="main" key="po^e_ti^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭcē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, v. poëticus, II.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36812" type="main" key="po^e_ti^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. poëticus.</entryFree>
poeticus: <entryFree id="n36813" type="greek" key="po^e_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">poihtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non poëtico sed quodam oratorio numero et modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <trans><tr>represented by the poets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of poets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui (perh. not anteAug., since the words ut poëtice loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>, seem not to be genuine), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtice vel oratorie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36813.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poihtikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the poetic art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poesy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o praeclaram emendatricem vitae poëticam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attigit quoque poëticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a poëtice alienus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poetilla: <entryFree id="n36814" type="spur" key="po^e_tilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētilla</orth>, a false read. for post illum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 4</bibl>.</entryFree>
poetneum: <entryFree id="n36815" type="main" key="Poetneum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poetneum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress of Athamania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poeto: <entryFree id="n36816" type="main" key="po^e_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v poëtor. <cb n="POLI" /></entryFree>
poetor: <entryFree id="n36817" type="main" key="po^e_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>poëta</etym>, <sense id="n36817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to poetize</hi> (ante- and postclass.): numquam poëtor nisi si podager, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 829</bibl> P. (Sat. v. 8 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ineptia poëtandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6 praef.</bibl></cit>—In an active collat. form: priusquam poëtare incipio, Verus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Caes. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Caes. 2, 8</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
poetria: <entryFree id="n36818" type="greek" key="po^e_tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poih/tria</foreign>, <sense id="n36818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum poëtria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 183</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 809</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poetris: <entryFree id="n36819" type="greek" key="po^e_tris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏētris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poihtri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 13</bibl> (al. poëtrias).</sense></entryFree>
pogonias: <entryFree id="n36820" type="greek" key="po_go_ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōgōnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pwgwni/as</foreign> (bearded), <sense id="n36820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of comet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pogonus: <entryFree id="n36821" type="main" key="Pogonus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pogonus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor in Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pol: <entryFree id="n36822" type="main" key="pol"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pol</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. Pollux.</entryFree>
pola: <entryFree id="n36823" type="main" key="Pola"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pola</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Istria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polea: <entryFree id="n36824" type="greek" key="po_le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pwli/on</foreign>, <sense id="n36824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dung of an ass's foal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 13, 57, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polemo: <entryFree id="n36825" type="main" key="Po^le^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlĕmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pole/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n36825.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian philosopher at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Xenocrates and teacher of Zeno and Arcesilaus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36825.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlĕ-mōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Polemonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Stoicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36825.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Pontus after Mithridates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36825.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlĕmōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Polemonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polemonia: <entryFree id="n36826" type="greek" key="po^le^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĕmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polemw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n36826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Greek valerian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> philaeteria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 28, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polemoniacus: <entryFree id="n36827" type="main" key="Po^le^mo_ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlĕmōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Polemo, II. B.</entryFree>
polenta: <entryFree id="n36828" type="main" key="po^lenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlen-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>; so <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15</bibl>) [perh. from <foreign lang="greek">pa/lh</foreign> = pollen], <sense id="n36828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peeled barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pearl-barley</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, qui polentam pinsitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 8, 37, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 23, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polentarius: <entryFree id="n36829" type="main" key="po^lenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>polenta</etym>, <sense id="n36829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pearl-barley</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepitus,</quote> <trans><tr>caused by eating pearl-barley</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <trans><tr>the loss of a mouthful of pearl-barley</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polentum: <entryFree id="n36830" type="main" key="po^lentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. polenta.</entryFree>
polia: <entryFree id="n36831" type="greek" key="po^li^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polia/</foreign>, <sense id="n36831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a gray color</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36832" type="greek" key="po_li_a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōlīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pwlei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stud of horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
polimen: <entryFree id="n36833" type="main" key="po^li_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. polio</etym>. <sense id="n36833.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi> (post-class.). baltei polimina, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 54, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36833.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">poli-mina</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the testicles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polimenta: <entryFree id="n36834" type="main" key="po^li_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlīmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the testicles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit> (dub.; Ritschl, sincipitamenta); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
polindrum: <entryFree id="n36835" type="spur" key="polindrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">polindrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, a false read. for cepolindrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 43</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
polio: <entryFree id="n36836" type="main" key="po^li^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n36836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf</hi> polibant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 436</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root par, in parēre, appārere; cf. pulcher</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furbish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polish</hi> (class.; syn.: limo, levigo). </sense><sense id="n36836.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ROGVM ASCIA NE POLITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem tectorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">daedala signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas cotibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 32, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna squatinae piscis cute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 34, § 108</bibl></cit>. marmora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabritiam ferri hircorum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis politus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polite lanceas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 46, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36836.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (= apparare, curare, colere), <hi rend="ital">to set off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>: causa poliendi agri, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 66, 27</bibl> (Ann. v. 324 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">campi politi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (Sat. v. 23 Vahl.); and: <cit><quote lang="la">politus culturā fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>to scour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 197</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:143" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:162" default="NO">162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum in filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minium in officinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf. Sillig ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus polita,</quote> <trans><tr>well-ordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regie polita aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36836.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>: ignarus poliendae orationis, Cic. <cb n="POLL" /> de Or. 1, 14, 63: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opus poliat lima non exterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam versibus senariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1, prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, prol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (in the trop. sense), <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinā homines,</quote><bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo politus e scholā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">politus artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (orator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem politum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>. accurata et polita oratio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ornata oratio et polita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus (in dicendo) politior et ornatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundia politiorem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo politioris humanitatis expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omni liberali doctrinā politissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a polished manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exquisitely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">polite subtiliterque effici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polite apteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornate politeque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">politius perfectiusque proferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">politius limare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36837" type="main" key="po^li^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. pellio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36838" type="main" key="Po_lio3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōlio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pollio</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a music-teacher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polion: <entryFree id="n36839" type="greek" key="po^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n36839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strong-smelling plant</hi>, perh. the <hi rend="ital">poley-germander</hi>: Teucrium polium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 21, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:145" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 84, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 83" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poliorcetes: <entryFree id="n36840" type="main" key="Po^li^orce_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlĭorcētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poliorkhth/s</foreign> (the besieger or stormer of cities), <sense id="n36840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Demetrius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Macedonia</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius expugnator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polite: <entryFree id="n36841" type="main" key="po^li_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. polio, <sense id="n36841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
polites: <entryFree id="n36842" type="main" key="Po^li_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poli/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n36842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Priam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Pyrrhus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 526</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 564</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
politia: <entryFree id="n36843" type="greek" key="po^li_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">politei/a</foreign>. <sense id="n36843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of one of Plato's works</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36843.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The administration of the Commonwealth</hi> (late Lat.), Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 15, 52; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
politicus: <entryFree id="n36844" type="greek" key="po^li_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">politiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to civil polity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">political</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>: libri, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
politio: <entryFree id="n36845" type="main" key="po^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. polio</etym>, <sense id="n36845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smoothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furbishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">smoothing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plastering</hi> a wall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36845.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an improving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
politor: <entryFree id="n36846" type="main" key="po^li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who furbishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">polishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a polisher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36846.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: gemmarum, Firm. Math. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n36846.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cultivator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
politorium: <entryFree id="n36847" type="main" key="Politori^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Politorĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">La Giostra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
politura: <entryFree id="n36848" type="main" key="po^li_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. polio</etym>, <sense id="n36848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furbishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">working at</hi>, etc. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum (of the vine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevitas et politura corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:31:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 31, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of a cobweb, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36848.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of literary composition: <cit><quote lang="la">videbimus quid parum recisum sit, quid non hujus recentis politurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
politus: <entryFree id="n36849" type="main" key="po^li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from polio.</entryFree>
polium: <entryFree id="n36850" type="main" key="po^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. polion.</entryFree>
polla: <entryFree id="n36851" type="main" key="Polla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Polla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>another form for Paulla, Paula</etym>, <sense id="n36851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36851.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of D. Brutus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36851.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the poet Lucan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:21:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:23:3" default="NO">7, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:64:1" default="NO">10, 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollen: <entryFree id="n36852" type="main" key="pollen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollis</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <sense id="n36852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [<foreign lang="greek">pa/lh</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n36852.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fine flour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milldust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:87" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 9, 20, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36852.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fine dust</hi> of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">piperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in pollinem tundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 29, § 91</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1392" /> <cb n="POLL" /></sense></entryFree>
pollens: <entryFree id="n36853" type="main" key="pollens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from polleo.</entryFree>
pollenter: <entryFree id="n36854" type="main" key="pollenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. polleo, <sense id="n36854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pollentia: <entryFree id="n36855" type="main" key="pollenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>polleo</etym>, <sense id="n36855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">might</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 3</bibl>.—Personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of victory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36856" type="main" key="Pollenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pōlent-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n36856.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Moline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36856.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pollentians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36856.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pollenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:157" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:598" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 598</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36856.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollentī-nus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pōlent-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pollentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pollentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polleo: <entryFree id="n36857" type="main" key="polle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĕo</orth> (polet, pollet: <sense id="n36857.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quia nondum geminabant antiqui consonantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl></cit> Müll.), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>potis-valeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36857.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36857.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">potent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avail</hi> (class.; cf.: valeo, possum): QVANTO MAGIS POTES POLLESQVE, an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest polletque (populus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 46</bibl>: qui plus pollet potiorque est patre, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollere, regnare, dominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in republicā tum plurimum pollebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: polleo plurimum inter homines, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fidem faciendam justitia plus pollet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Romana majestas toto orbe polleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is omnibus exemplo debet esse, quantum in hac urbe polleat, multorum obedire tempori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36857.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriā antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36857.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to be potent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to operate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba contra anginas efficacissime pollet,</quote> <trans><tr>is a powerful specific</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 110, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollet adversus scorpiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 16, 63, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum plurimis modis pollet in remediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 25, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:114" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 29, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36857.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36857.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be of worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be valued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 17, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eadem vitis aliud aliis in locis polleat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36857.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To possess in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be rich in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utensilibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potent</hi> (mostly since the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): genus pollens atque honoratissumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus, abunde pollens potensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens pollensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 50, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus pollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis plurimum pollens mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens pollentior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollentissima ingenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <case>abl.</case>: sagittis pollens dea, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 5</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 11 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">equo pollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:85" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 85</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini pollens Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit> (Fleck. as one word, vinipollens).—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror cuncta pollentis viri, Argolica Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 805" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 805</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare sereno Imperio vulgum pollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 685</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> pollentius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollex: <entryFree id="n36858" type="main" key="pollex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>polleo; cf.: pollex nomen ab eo, quod pollet, accepit, Atei. Cap'to ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n36858.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36858.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The thumb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis digiti articulos habent ternos, pollex binos et digitis adversus universis flectitur, per se vero in obliquum porrigitur, crassior ceteris, huic minimus mensura par est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 68</bibl>.—Connected with digitus (as a measure), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R.
