R. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi digiti pollicis crassitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—To close down the thumb (premere) was a sign of approbation; to extend it (vertere, convertere; <cit><quote lang="la">pollex infestus), a sign of disapprobation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 1097</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36858.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The great toe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollices manūs et pedis dextri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 8, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36858.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36858.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stump of a vine-branch left in pruning</hi>, = resex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:13" default="NO">4, 24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl>, <cb n="POLL" /> § 14; 17, 22, 35, § 184.—</sense><sense id="n36858.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A knob</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protuberance</hi> on the trunk of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36859" type="main" key="Pollex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 47, 1</bibl>.—A lusus verbb. with 1. pollex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 46, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollia: <entryFree id="n36860" type="main" key="Polli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollĭa trĭbus</orth>, <sense id="n36860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Roman tribes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 400, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicaris: <entryFree id="n36861" type="main" key="polli^ca_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pollex</etym>, <sense id="n36861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a thumb</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">frutex pollicari crassitudine,</quote> <trans><tr>of the thickness of a thumb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 24, 26, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 49, § 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polliceor: <entryFree id="n36862" type="main" key="polli^ce^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus</itype> (<sense id="n36862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form polliceres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menip. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menip. 8, 5</bibl>), 2, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from an old <pos>prep.</pos> por or port (= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">porti/, proti/</foreign>, or <foreign lang="greek">pro/s</foreign>; cf. pro) and liceor</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36862.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi> any thing (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: promitto, spondeo): neque minus prolixe de tuā voluntate promisi, quam eram solitus de meā polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mirandum in modum profitentur, offerunt se, pollicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id omne tibi polliceor ac defero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro certo polliceor hoc vobis atque confirmo me esse perfecturum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo ut ponatur, verum etiam ut inviolata maneat pollicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:52:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 52, 4</bibl>: alicui divitias, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 359 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium et cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus pollicere quam ego a te postulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo Qui sum pollicitus ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum pollicitus est dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicentur obsides dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 4, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: montes auri, <hi rend="ital">to promise mountains of gold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">boundless wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: maria montesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36862.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n36862.3" n="1" level="3"> Of an orator, in opening his speech, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso ut, quid pollicitus sim, diligenter memoriae mandetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docui, quod primum pollicitus sum, causam omnino, cur postularet, non fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36862.4" n="2" level="3"> Of purchasers, <hi rend="ital">to bid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illic pollicitus est prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36862.5" n="3" level="3"> Of auspices, <hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id assuetae sanguine et praedā aves pollicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> (ante-class.): ne dares, ne polliceres, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36862.6" n="2" level="3"> polliceor, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: ut aliis ob metum statuae polliceantur, Metell. Numid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 972</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicita fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:366" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 366</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Pasch. 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicitus torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 140</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭ-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something promised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a promise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 632</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memores polliciti nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tu pollicitis corrumpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicitis captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicitatio: <entryFree id="n36863" type="main" key="polli^ci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pollicitor</etym>, <sense id="n36863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a promise</hi> (class. but not in Cic., who uses promissio, promissum; usu. <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne istaec pollicitatio Te in crimen populo ponat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc pollicitationes aufer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic magnis praemiis pollicitationibusque persuadet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 33, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 1</bibl> sqq.—In <number>sing.</number>: cum (legionem) ad se arcessisset Antonius hac pollicitatione, denarios quingenos singulis militibus daturum, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 422, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nudā pollicitatione nulla actio nascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicitator: <entryFree id="n36864" type="main" key="polli^ci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promiser</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicitatrix: <entryFree id="n36865" type="main" key="polli^ci^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pollicitator</etym>, <sense id="n36865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that promises</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicitor: <entryFree id="n36866" type="main" key="polli^ci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>polliceor</etym>, <sense id="n36866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): pro capite argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam suam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 6</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te complures menses tuli Pollicitantem, nihil ferentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: sollicitando et pollicitando, id. <cb n="POLL" /> And. 5, 4, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">largiundo atque pollicitando magis incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollicitum: <entryFree id="n36867" type="main" key="polli^ci^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. polliceor <sense id="n36867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pollicitus: <entryFree id="n36868" type="main" key="polli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from polliceor.</entryFree>
pollinaris: <entryFree id="n36869" type="gloss" key="polli^na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pollen</etym>, <sense id="n36869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fine flour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flour-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meal-</hi>: pollinare cribrum, <foreign lang="greek">guristh/rion ko/skinon</foreign>, Gloss. Cyril.; v. pollinarius.</sense></entryFree>
pollinarius: <entryFree id="n36870" type="main" key="polli^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fine flour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flour-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meal-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bolting-sieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollinctor: <entryFree id="n36871" type="main" key="pollinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollinctor</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollictor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pollingo</etym>, <sense id="n36871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who washes corpses and prepares them for burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollinctores sunt, qui mortuos curant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pollinctores dicti sunt, qui funera morientium accurant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 559, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 60</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:97:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 97, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">buriers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 39, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollinctus: <entryFree id="n36872" type="main" key="pollinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pollingo.</entryFree>
pollingo: <entryFree id="n36873" type="main" key="pollingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n36873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash a corpse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and prepare it for the funeral pile</hi> (ante- and post-class.): pollingo, <foreign lang="greek">periste/llw nekro/n, siroplo/kw, tarixeu/w, e)ntafia/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia mihi pollinctor dixit, qui eum pollinxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 362, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figmenta hominum mortuorum curate pollincta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an old man near his grave: <cit><quote lang="la">pollinctum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas fucata aut medicamentis pollincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pollio: <entryFree id="n36874" type="gloss" key="polli^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollĭo</orth>, īre: pollit, pila ludit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36875" type="main" key="Polli^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōlĭo</orth>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 33</bibl> Lachm.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So esp., </sense><sense id="n36875.1" n="I" level="1"> Asinius Pollio, v. Asinius.—</sense><sense id="n36875.2" n="II" level="1"> Trebellius Pollio, v. Trebellius.—</sense><sense id="n36875.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a bad actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 37</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n36875.4" n="IV" level="1"> v. Polio.</sense></entryFree>
pollis: <entryFree id="n36876" type="main" key="pollis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollis</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. pollen.</entryFree>
pollubrum: <entryFree id="n36877" type="main" key="pollu_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūbrum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pōlūbr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>polluo</etym>, <sense id="n36877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wash-basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laver</hi>: polubrum pelluvium vas, quod nos pelvem vocamus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=247" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 247</bibl> Müll.: polubrum quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">xe/rniba</foreign>, nos trulleum vocamus. Livius: argenteo polubro (acc. to Hom. Od. 1, 136); <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius Pictor, lib. xvi.: polubrum sinistrā manu teneto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 22 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
polluceo: <entryFree id="n36878" type="main" key="pollu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūcĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>old <pos>prep.</pos> port = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">proti/, pro/s</foreign>, and liceor; root licof linquo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">leipw</foreign>; cf. licet</etym>. <sense id="n36878.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to place upon the altar as a sacrifice to the deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi dapali culignam vini quantumvis polluceto ... cum pollucere oportebit, sic facies, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132</bibl></cit>: polluxi tibi iam publicando epulo Herculis decumas, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 874</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 9 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">decumam partem Herculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: pisces, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 10, § 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollucere merces (quas cuivis deo) liceat, sunt far, polenta, vinum, panis fermentalis, ficus passa, suilla, bubula, agnina, casei, ovilla, alica, sesama et oleum, pisces quibus est squama praeter scarum: Herculi autem omnia esculenta, potulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n36878.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36878.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To serve up</hi> as a dish: non ego sum pollucta pago, <hi rend="ital">I am no dish for the village</hi> (like the Engl. saying, <hi rend="ital">I am meat for your master</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36878.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To entertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to treal</hi> with a thing (ante- and post-class.). * </sense><sense id="n36878.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, jocosely: <cit><quote lang="la">polluctus virgis servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n36878.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to share in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">partake of</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 164</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36878.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pol-luctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the thing offered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an offering;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificial banquet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">polluctum quod a porricendo est fictum. Cum enim ex mercibus libamenta porrecta sunt Herculi in aram, tum polluctum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl></cit> Müll.: ad polluctum emere, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 10, § 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polluctum Herculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36878.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">polluctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with rich offerings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently</hi>: pollucte prodigus, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. prodegeris, p. 229 Müll. (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
polluces: <entryFree id="n36879" type="main" key="Pollu_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollūces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Pollux <sense id="n36879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pollucibilis: <entryFree id="n36880" type="main" key="pollu_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>polluceo, bountifully distributed; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n36880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi> (post-class.): cena, <pb n="1393" /> <cb n="POLL" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:71" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 71</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonandi pollucibilior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūcĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsonate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: pergraecamini, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollucibilitas: <entryFree id="n36881" type="hapax" key="pollu_ci^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūcĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pollucibilis</etym>, <sense id="n36881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">magnificence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pollucibiliter: <entryFree id="n36882" type="main" key="pollu_ci^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūcĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pollucibilis <sense id="n36882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pollucte: <entryFree id="n36883" type="main" key="pollucte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">polluctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">polluctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. polluceo <sense id="n36883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
polluctura: <entryFree id="n36884" type="hapax" key="polluctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">polluctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>polluceo</etym>, <sense id="n36884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sumptuous entertainment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banquet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polluctus: <entryFree id="n36885" type="main" key="polluctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">polluctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from polluceo.</entryFree>
pollulus: <entryFree id="n36886" type="main" key="pollu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollŭlus</orth>, v. polulus.</entryFree>
polluo: <entryFree id="n36887" type="main" key="pollu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf.: adluo, diluo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lou/w</foreign>, to wash; <foreign lang="greek">lu=ma, lu/mh, lumai/nw</foreign>, to cleanse, ruin</etym>, <sense id="n36887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36887.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ore dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollui cuncta sanie, odore, contactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu tegmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina deciduo immundiore lapsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 23, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polluta mensa cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:183" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36887.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36887.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to defile</hi> morally, <hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contaminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desecrate</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: inquino, contamino): polluta et violata sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum hominumque jura inexpiabili scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris filiam incesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragico pollutus concubitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam domūs stupro turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Electrae jugulo se polluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem suam et aures hominum nefariā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: incestis se matrimoniis, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 3: jejunia, <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <trans><tr>to insult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 8: ferias, <hi rend="ital">to desecrate</hi> (by labor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 28, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia invadit, polluit, vastat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 794</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polluta pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polluendam perdendamque rempublicam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to render unclean</hi>, in a ceremonial sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 7, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be unclean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 32: pollutum et mundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: pollutum comedit, id. Osee, 9, 3.—</sense><sense id="n36887.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi> a woman (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 18, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pollū-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">no longer virgin</hi>, then <hi rend="ital">vicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:60:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 60, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelesta pollutaque femina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, 34</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <trans><tr>more vicious</tr>, <tr>more sinful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:47" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pollutio: <entryFree id="n36888" type="main" key="pollu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>polluo</etym>, <sense id="n36888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defilement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contamination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pollutrix: <entryFree id="n36889" type="main" key="pollu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pollūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polluter</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
pollux: <entryFree id="n36890" type="main" key="Pollux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pollux</orth>, <itype>ūcis</itype> (collat. form of <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pol-lūces</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 53</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 73</bibl> Müll.—<sense id="n36890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> pol, edepol, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poludeu/khs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a famous pugilist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Tyndarus and Leda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Castor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in connection with whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the constellation of the Twins</hi> (Gemini, v. 2. Castor), <hi rend="ital">he serves as a guide to mariners</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:173" default="NO">173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me ... Castor, Polluces ... dique omnes ament,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 53</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 27.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminus Pollux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 64</bibl></cit>: facere aliquem de Polluce Castora, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make a knight of a pugilist</hi> (pugil), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:57:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 57, 1</bibl>.— As a deity: DEVS VINCIVS POLLVX, Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, n. 218.—In <case>voc.</case>, contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pol</orth>, and length. <orth extent="full" lang="la">edepol</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aedep-</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos> (cf.: ecastor, equirine, etc.), <hi rend="ital">by Pollux! indeed! truly!</hi> pol mihi fortuna magis nunc defit quam genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 394 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 100 ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:190" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 190</bibl>; Com. Fragm. p. 67 Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per pol quam paucos reperias meretricibus fideles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol, me miserum, patrone, vocares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 138</bibl>.—In connection with other particles of affirmation: <cit><quote lang="la">pol profecto,</quote> <trans><tr>indeed</tr>, <tr>truly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe pol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane pol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 65</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="POLY" /> In the form edepol: <cit><quote lang="la">certe edepol scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo edepol equidem dormire Solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 126</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">180.—With other particles: ne edepol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol volo profecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe edepol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo edepol vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polose: <entryFree id="n36891" type="hapax" key="po^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>polus</etym>, <sense id="n36891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going through the poles</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obliqua decussata polose,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 37</bibl></cit> (al. oblique decussatos polos).</sense></entryFree>
polteo: <entryFree id="n36892" type="gloss" key="polte^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poltĕo</orth>, <itype>pro ulteriore</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
polubrum: <entryFree id="n36893" type="main" key="po_lu_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōlūbrum</orth>, v. pollubrum.</entryFree>
polulus: <entryFree id="n36894" type="main" key="po_lu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōlŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">poll-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a rustic form for paululus</etym>, <sense id="n36894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little</hi> (only in the two foll. pass.): <cit><quote lang="la">labellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublaminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polus: <entryFree id="n36895" type="greek" key="po^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/los</foreign>. <sense id="n36895.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the end of an axis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pole</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra a verticibus duobus, quos appellaverunt polos, centrum caeli est, nec non Signiferi oblique inter eos siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 70, 71, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus glacialis,</quote> <trans><tr>the north pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 173</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, gelidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 152</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the north pole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus australis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 131</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, austrinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the south pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36895.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36895.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The polar star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36895.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The heavens</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 14</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 190 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 586</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 721</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:622" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 622</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensi parva figura poli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:278" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 278</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36896" type="main" key="Po^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek tragic actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polusca: <entryFree id="n36897" type="main" key="Polusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Polusca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small and very ancient town in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes">39</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, p. 645.</sense></entryFree>
polyacanthos: <entryFree id="n36898" type="greek" key="po^ly^a^canthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyăcanthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polua/kanqos</foreign>, <sense id="n36898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyaegos: <entryFree id="n36899" type="main" key="Po^ly^aegos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyaegos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/aigos</foreign>, <sense id="n36899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyaenus: <entryFree id="n36900" type="main" key="Po^ly^aenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyaenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/ainos</foreign>, <sense id="n36900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mathematician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend and follower of Epicurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyandrion: <entryFree id="n36901" type="greek" key="po^ly^andri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyandrĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polua/ndrion</foreign>, <sense id="n36901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common burial-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graveyard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cemetery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 72, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyanthemum: <entryFree id="n36902" type="greek" key="po^ly^anthe^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyanthĕmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polua/nqemon</foreign> (pure Lat. ranunculus), <sense id="n36902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a caustic plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> batrachion (perh. Ranunculus polyanthemos, Linn., <hi rend="ital">many-flowered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowfoot</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 90, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyarchion: <entryFree id="n36903" type="greek" key="po^ly^archi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyarchĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cyon</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poluarxi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n36903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soothing ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:24:136" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 24, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polybe: <entryFree id="n36904" type="main" key="Poly^be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Polybē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fifty daughters of Danaüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polybius: <entryFree id="n36905" type="main" key="Po^ly^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlybĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/bios</foreign>, <sense id="n36905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek historian from Megalopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Lycortas and friend of the younger Scipio Africanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:21:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 21, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polybus: <entryFree id="n36906" type="main" key="Po^ly^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlybus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*po/lubos</foreign>. <sense id="n36906.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at whose court Œdipus was brought up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 66" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:67" default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36906.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Penelope's suitors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polycarpos: <entryFree id="n36907" type="greek" key="po^ly^carpos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlycarpos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/karpos</foreign>, <sense id="n36907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polygonus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polychronius: <entryFree id="n36908" type="greek" key="po^lychro^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlychrŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">poluxro/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n36908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long-lived</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. Math. 8, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
polyclitus: <entryFree id="n36909" type="main" key="Po^ly^cli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyclītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlŭ-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ētus</orth>) (ĕ scanned short, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 269), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/kleitos</foreign>, <sense id="n36909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian sculptor from Argos or Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Pericles.</hi>—Form Polyclitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl> § 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 2</bibl>. —Form POLYCLETVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3245</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyclētēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Polycletean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:67" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polycnemon: <entryFree id="n36910" type="greek" key="po^lycne_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlycnēmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/knhmon</foreign>, <sense id="n36910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 88, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polycrates: <entryFree id="n36911" type="main" key="Po^lycra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlycrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polukra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n36911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prince of Samos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of Amasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for his good fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but at last crucified by the Persian governor Orœtes</hi>, <cb n="POLY" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>— Gr. <case>acc.</case> in -en, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polycratia: <entryFree id="n36912" type="main" key="Po^lycra^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlycrătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wife of the Achœan chief Aratus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polydaemon: <entryFree id="n36913" type="main" key="Po^ly^daemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlydaemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a descendant of Semiramis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polydamas: <entryFree id="n36914" type="main" key="Po_^ly^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pō^lydămas</orth> (the o made long by the requirements of the verse), <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poluda/mas</foreign>. <sense id="n36914.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Panthous and friend of Hector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 94</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36914.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pō^lydămantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Polydamas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:212" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 212</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36914.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous athlete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
polydectes: <entryFree id="n36915" type="main" key="Po^ly^dectes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlydectes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polude/kths</foreign>, <sense id="n36915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Seriphus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who brought up Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polydector: <entryFree id="n36916" type="main" key="Po^ly^dector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlydector</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fifty sons of Ægyptus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polydorus: <entryFree id="n36917" type="main" key="Po^ly^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlydōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/dwros</foreign>, <sense id="n36917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Priam and Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by the Thracian Polymnestor</hi>, Cic. poët. de Or. 3, 58, 219; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:432 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 432 sq.</bibl> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n36917.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlydōrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Polydorus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Polydorean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 629</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polygala: <entryFree id="n36918" type="greek" key="po^ly^ga^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/galon</foreign>, <sense id="n36918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb milkwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 96, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygnotus: <entryFree id="n36919" type="main" key="Po^lygno_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlygnōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/gnwtos</foreign>, <sense id="n36919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian painter and statuary of Thasus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygonaton: <entryFree id="n36920" type="greek" key="po^ly^go^na^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygŏnăton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polugo/naton</foreign>. <sense id="n36920.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant called Solomon's seal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Convallaria polygonatum (Linn.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36920.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for</hi> leucacantha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygonium: <entryFree id="n36921" type="main" key="po^ly^go^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. polygonos.</entryFree>
polygonius: <entryFree id="n36922" type="greek" key="po^lygo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">polugw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n36922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many angles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polygonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polygonoides: <entryFree id="n36923" type="greek" key="po^ly^go^no^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygŏnŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polugonoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> clematis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 90, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygonos: <entryFree id="n36924" type="greek" key="po^ly^go^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygŏnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏly-gŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 193" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 193</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/gonos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">-on</foreign>, <sense id="n36924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (called in pure Lat. herba sanguinalis or sanguinaria), <hi rend="ital">knotgrass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:158" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygonum: <entryFree id="n36925" type="greek" key="po^ly^go_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/gwnon</foreign>, <sense id="n36925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polygon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
polygrammos: <entryFree id="n36926" type="greek" key="po^lygrammos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygrammos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/grammos</foreign>, <sense id="n36926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of jasper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with many white streaks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polygynaecon: <entryFree id="n36927" type="spur" key="po^ly^gy^naecon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlygynaecon</orth>, <itype>i, a false reading for syngenicon</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 134</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
polyhistor: <entryFree id="n36928" type="main" key="Po^ly^histor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyhistor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polui/stwr</foreign> (the much-knowing or learned man). <sense id="n36928.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of the natural history written by C. Julius Solinus.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n36928.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of the grammarian Cornelius Alexander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyhymnia: <entryFree id="n36929" type="main" key="Po^ly^hymni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyhymnĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymnĭa</orth>, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 1, p. 51 Burm.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polumni/a</foreign> (she of many hymns), <sense id="n36929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:31:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 31, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyidus: <entryFree id="n36930" type="main" key="Po^ly^i^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/i+dos</foreign>, <sense id="n36930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native of Corinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polymachaeroplagides: <entryFree id="n36931" type="main" key="Po^ly^ma^chaero^pla^gi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymăchaerŏplăgĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">polu/s-ma/xaira</foreign>-plaga</etym>, <sense id="n36931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name of a soldier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polymestor: <entryFree id="n36932" type="main" key="Po^ly^mestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymestor</orth>, v. Polymnestor.</entryFree>
polymita: <entryFree id="n36933" type="main" key="po^ly^mi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlymĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. polymitus.</entryFree>
polymitarius: <entryFree id="n36934" type="main" key="po^ly^mi^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlymĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <etym>polymitus</etym>, <sense id="n36934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of damask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highly wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:36:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 36, 35</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏly-mĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a damask-weaver</hi>, Ven. Carm. 5, 6 praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polymitus: <entryFree id="n36935" type="greek" key="po^ly^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlymĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/mitos</foreign>, <sense id="n36935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrought with many treads</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of weaving</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏly-mĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">damask</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 198</bibl>; also <number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlymĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polymnestor: <entryFree id="n36936" type="main" key="Po^lymne_stor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymnēstor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymēstor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polumnh/stwr</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*polumh/stwr</foreign>, <sense id="n36936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Ilione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Priam; he killed his brotherin-law<pb n="1394" /> <cb n="POLY" />  Polydorus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had been intrusted to his charge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 109" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 109</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 2, 209; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polymnia: <entryFree id="n36937" type="main" key="Po^lymni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlymnĭa</orth>, v. Polyhymnia.</entryFree>
polymyxos: <entryFree id="n36938" type="greek" key="po^ly^myxos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlymyxos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n36938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/mucos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">having many wicks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:41" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 41</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
polyneuron: <entryFree id="n36939" type="greek" key="po^ly^neuron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyneuron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/neuron</foreign>, <sense id="n36939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (pure Lat. plantago major), <hi rend="ital">great plantain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polynices: <entryFree id="n36940" type="main" key="Po^ly_ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlȳnīces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polunei/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n36940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Œdipus and Jocasta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Eteocles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and son-in-law of Adrastus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:689" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 689</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 68" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:72" default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyonymos: <entryFree id="n36941" type="greek" key="po^ly^o_ny^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyōnymos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poluw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n36941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (pure Lat. perdicium), <hi rend="ital">parietary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyphagus: <entryFree id="n36942" type="greek" key="po^ly^pha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyphăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polufa/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n36942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyphemus: <entryFree id="n36943" type="main" key="Po^ly^phe_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyphēmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polu/fhmos</foreign>. <sense id="n36943.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The one-eyed Cyclops in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was blinded by Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 772</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 49, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:64" default="NO">9, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 125" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 125</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:618 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 618 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyplusius: <entryFree id="n36944" type="main" key="Po^ly^plu_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyplūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">poluplou/sios</foreign> (very rich), <sense id="n36944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name of a</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polypodium: <entryFree id="n36945" type="greek" key="po^ly^po^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlypŏdĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polupo/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n36945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polypody</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 75, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyposus: <entryFree id="n36946" type="main" key="po^ly^po_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlypōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>polypus</etym>, <sense id="n36946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a polypus in the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyptoton: <entryFree id="n36947" type="greek" key="po^lypto_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyptōton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/ptwton</foreign>, <sense id="n36947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when several cases of the same word stand together</hi>, as homo homini, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyptycha: <entryFree id="n36948" type="greek" key="po^lypty^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyptycha</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/ptuxa</foreign> (that has many folds or leaves), <sense id="n36948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accountbooks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">registers</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 19</bibl>; Cod. Th. 1, 26, 2; 1, 28, 13.</sense></entryFree>
polypus: <entryFree id="n36949" type="greek" key="po_^ly^pu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pō^lypŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n36949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 4</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">polu/pous</foreign> (many-footed; Dor. and Æol. <foreign lang="greek">pwlu/pos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a polypus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36949.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An aquatic animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-polypus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sepia octopodia, Linn.: piscis polypus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 12, 14, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:71 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 35, § 71 al.</bibl> (Jahn, polybi); Lucil. l. l.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 10 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hal. 31</bibl> (with the o long).—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of rapacious men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36949.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A polypus in the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 12, 5</bibl> (with the o long).</sense></entryFree>
polyrrhizos: <entryFree id="n36950" type="greek" key="po^lyrrhi_zos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyrrhīzos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/rrizos</foreign>. <sense id="n36950.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having many roots</hi>, an appellation of several plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54</bibl>, §§ 96, 98 al.— </sense><sense id="n36950.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyrrhīzon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 103, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polysemus: <entryFree id="n36951" type="greek" key="po^ly^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlysēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/shmos</foreign>, <sense id="n36951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many significations</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polysigma: <entryFree id="n36952" type="main" key="po^ly^sigma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlysigma</orth> <etym><foreign lang="greek">polu/-si/gma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n36952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a too frequent repetition of the letter</hi> s: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi s littera crebrius geminatur: Sosia in Solario soleas sarciebat suas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
