polyspaston: <entryFree id="n36953" type="greek" key="po^lyspaston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyspaston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/spaston</foreign>, <sense id="n36953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoisting-tackle with many pulleys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>, and 16.</sense></entryFree>
polytimetus: <entryFree id="n36954" type="main" key="Po^ly^ti_me_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlytīmētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Sogdiana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Koi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Bokhara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polytrichon: <entryFree id="n36955" type="greek" key="po^ly^tri^chon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlytrĭchon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/trixon</foreign>. <sense id="n36955.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The herb golden-hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venus's-hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 63</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlythrix</orth>, <itype>trĭchos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">polu/qric</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 147</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n36955.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyxena: <entryFree id="n36956" type="main" key="Po^lyxe^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyxĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poluce/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n36956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Priam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Pyrrhus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Achilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificed at his father's grave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 448</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:262" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 368" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 110" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 110</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 321</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36956.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyxĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Polyxena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Polyxenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 369</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
polyxo: <entryFree id="n36957" type="main" key="Po^lyxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏlyxo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*polucw/</foreign>. <sense id="n36957.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prophetess in Lemnos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:90 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 90 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:316 sq" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 316 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36957.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Hyades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
polyzonos: <entryFree id="n36958" type="greek" key="po^lyzo_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏlyzōnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/zwnos</foreign>, <sense id="n36958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of black precious stone with many stripes</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>. <cb n="POMP" /></sense></entryFree>
pomarius: <entryFree id="n36959" type="main" key="po_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pomum</etym>, <sense id="n36959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fruit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fruit-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36959.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36959.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-seller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruiterer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 651, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36959.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n36959.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fruit-garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orchard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 14</bibl>; Ov. de Nuce, 111; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36959.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A store-room for fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-loft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 23</bibl> P., <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc. locus, but without proof).</sense></entryFree>
pomeridianus: <entryFree id="n36960" type="main" key="po_me^ri_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmĕrīdĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">postm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>post-meridianus</etym>, <sense id="n36960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the afternoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post-meridian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetratum est a consuetudine, ut peccare suavitatis causā liceret, et pomeridianus quadrigas quam postmeridianus libentius dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomeridianum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: postmeridianum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnomonis umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomeridiana sessio (opp. ambulatio antemeridiana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pomerium: <entryFree id="n36961" type="main" key="po_me_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmērĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmoerĭum</orth> (the first is most freq. in inscrr., the latter in MSS.; <sense id="n36961.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but the better manuscripts have also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 23</bibl> and 24, pomerium. A third form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post-moerium</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl> Müll., seems merely to have been assumed from the etymology; a fourth archaic form is <orth extent="full" lang="la">posi-merium</orth>, <itype>pontificale pomoerium</itype>, qui auspicato olim quidem omnem urbem ambiebat praeter Aventinum ... estque prosimerium quasi proxi-murium, pontifices auspicabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=248" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 248</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>post-moerus = murus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36961.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the open space left free from buildings within and without the walls of a town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bounded by stones</hi> (cippi or termini), <hi rend="ital">and limiting the city auspices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO">15, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 23</bibl> and 24: POMERIVM, Inscr. (746 A. U. C.) Orell. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 242</bibl> (Orell. 1, p. 567); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 710</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Inscr. (A. D. 121) Orell. 811: pomoerium intrare, transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pomoerii jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales intra pomeria nati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36961.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limits</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui minore pomerio finierunt,</quote> <trans><tr>who have prescribed narrower limits to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pometia: <entryFree id="n36962" type="main" key="Po_me_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmē tii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>), <sense id="n36962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very old town of the Volsci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Suessa Pometia; perh. the mod. <hi rend="ital">Torre Petrara</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Mesa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 25 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmētīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pometia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pometian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pometum: <entryFree id="n36963" type="main" key="po_me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pomus</etym>, <sense id="n36963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with fruit-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orchard</hi> (post-class. for pomarium), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pomifer: <entryFree id="n36964" type="main" key="po_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pomum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n36964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-bringing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 700" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <trans><tr>tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SVLVANVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 70, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmĭ-ferae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 43, § 253</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pomoerium: <entryFree id="n36965" type="main" key="po_moerium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmoerium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. pomerium.</entryFree>
pomona: <entryFree id="n36966" type="main" key="Po_mo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pomum</etym>. <sense id="n36966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of fruit and fruit-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pomona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 623</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36966.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl> prooem. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">1: Thyle larga et diutina Pomona copiosa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n36966.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n36966.3" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmōnal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the temple of Pomona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n36966.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōmōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pomona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pomonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. v. maximae dignationis, pp. 154 and 155 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pomosus: <entryFree id="n36967" type="main" key="po_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in fruit</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit> (25): <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 81; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pomosi Tiburis arva, Col. poët. 10, 138: corona,</quote> <trans><tr>a chaplet of fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 17.</sense></entryFree>
pompa: <entryFree id="n36968" type="main" key="pompa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pomph/</foreign>, <sense id="n36968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn procession</hi>,<cb n="POMP" />  <hi rend="ital">a public procession</hi> of any kind (at public festivals, games, triumphs, marriages, funerals, etc.). </sense><sense id="n36968.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36968.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pompā cum magna vis auri argentique ferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Dionysia pompam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnes ordine pompas Exequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnes ducere pompas Ad delubra juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontico triumpho inter pompae fercula trium verborum protulit titulum: veni, vidi, vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pompa Indica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the triumphal procession of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver Clodii spoliatum exsequiis, pompā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a funeral procession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pompam funeris ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend a funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:663" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompam parare triumphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exornaturus victoris superbi pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomparum ferculis similes esse (referring to the slowness of such processions),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36968.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the processions at the Circensian games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which images of the gods were carried</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 43 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 622, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of Cæsar, whose image was carried among them: tu hunc de pompā, Quirini contubernalem, laetaturum putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36968.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36968.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">row</hi>, <hi rend="ital">array</hi> of persons or things (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molesta haec pompa lictorum meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo tota petitio cura ut pompae plena sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 13:52" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:281" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 281</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae pompa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 15</bibl></cit>: ventri portatur pompa, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rich repast</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera certā discurrunt pompā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus pompae armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 47, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36968.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Parade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pomp</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. apparatus): rhetorum pompa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo adhibere quandam speciem atque pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detraxit muneri suo pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pompam vel ostentationem aliquid accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis pompae quam pugnae aptius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eorum partim in pompā, partim in acie illustres esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pompabilis: <entryFree id="n36969" type="main" key="pompa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pompa</etym>, <sense id="n36969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: nihil pompabilius, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 30.</sense></entryFree>
pompabiliter: <entryFree id="n36970" type="main" key="pompa_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pompalis <sense id="n36970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pompalis: <entryFree id="n36971" type="main" key="pompa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pompa</etym>, <sense id="n36971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">showy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pompālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompously</hi>, etc.: ornatus, Treb. Gallien. 8 (al. pompabiliter).</sense></entryFree>
pompalitas: <entryFree id="n36972" type="main" key="pompa_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pompalis</etym>, <sense id="n36972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi> of style (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1320</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pompaliter: <entryFree id="n36973" type="main" key="pompa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pompalis <sense id="n36973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pompaticus: <entryFree id="n36974" type="main" key="pompa_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pompa</etym>, <sense id="n36974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">showy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus vehiculi, for state occasions,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pompātĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 6, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Jul. Vict. Rhet. 10, p. 233: favor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pompatilis: <entryFree id="n36975" type="main" key="pompa_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = pompalis (eccl. Lat.): fastus, Aug. Alterc. Eccl. et Synag. p. 1132.</entryFree>
pompatus: <entryFree id="n36976" type="main" key="pompa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pompo.</entryFree>
pompeja: <entryFree id="n36977" type="main" key="Pompe_ja"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompēja</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Pompejus.</entryFree>
pompejanus: <entryFree id="n36978" type="main" key="Pompe_ja_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pompeji, II., and Pompejus, B.</entryFree>
pompeji: <entryFree id="n36979" type="main" key="Pompe_ji"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompēji</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime city in the south of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with Herculaneum and Stabiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by an eruption of Vesuvius</hi>, A. D. 79, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36979.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pompeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:265" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36979.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36979.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pom-pējānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a villa of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Pompeii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36979.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pompeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pompeians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pompejopolis: <entryFree id="n36980" type="main" key="Pompe_jo^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n36980.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of</hi> <pb n="1395" /> <cb n="POMP" /> <hi rend="ital">Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called Soli</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mezetli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36980.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Paphlagonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tash Kupri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pompejus: <entryFree id="n36981" type="main" key="Pompe_jus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompēïus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompēja</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So the famous Cn. Pompejus Magnus, <hi rend="ital">the triumvir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1</bibl> sqq. et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Pompeja, <hi rend="ital">his sister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">another,</quote> <trans><tr>his daughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 95:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 95, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">a third,</quote> <trans><tr>daughter of Q. Pompeius</tr>, <tr>wife of Julius Cœsar</tr>, <tr>divorced from him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36981.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pompēïus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Pompey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <trans><tr>at Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23, 45</bibl></cit> (3, 30, 11); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>leading through Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36981.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Pompey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus (usually called Pompeja porticus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:29" default="NO">14, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, Notus,</quote> <trans><tr>which blew in Pompey's theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 21</bibl></cit>: ficus (also called Pompeja ficus), Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36981.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompējāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soldiers of Pompey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompey's party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompey's troops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 30, 5</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompejanus Cilix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 448</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pompeum: <entryFree id="n36982" type="main" key="Pompe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a building at Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pompholyx: <entryFree id="n36983" type="greek" key="pompho^lyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pomphŏlyx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pomfo/luc</foreign>, <sense id="n36983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a substance deposited from the smoke of smelting-furnaces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompholyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pompilius: <entryFree id="n36984" type="main" key="Pompi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n36984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. The most celebrated is Numa Pompilius, <hi rend="ital">the second king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36984.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pom-pĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pompilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pompilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>descendants of Numa Pompilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 292</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36984.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pompilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curia,</quote> <trans><tr>built by Numa</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigitamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pompilus: <entryFree id="n36985" type="greek" key="pompi_^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompī^lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pompi/los</foreign>, <sense id="n36985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seafish</hi> (that follows ships), <hi rend="ital">the pilot-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder-fish</hi> (Gasterosteus ductor, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:101" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 15, 20, § 51</bibl>.—This name was applied by some to the nautilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pompo: <entryFree id="n36986" type="main" key="pompo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompo</orth>, no <sense id="n36986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">with pomp</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">grandisonis pompare modis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pompātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently ordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompatior suggestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pomponius: <entryFree id="n36987" type="main" key="Pompo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n36987.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Pomponius, <hi rend="ital">an Atellane poet of Bononia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36987.2" n="II" level="1"> T. Pomponius Atticus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life is written by Nepos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n36987.3" n="III" level="1"> P. Pomponius Secundus, <hi rend="ital">a tragedian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98" default="NO">10, 1, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36987.4" n="IV" level="1"> Sex. Pomponius, <hi rend="ital">a lawyer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36987.5" n="V" level="1"> M. Pomponius Matho, <hi rend="ital">a prœtor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and augur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36987.6" n="VI" level="1"> Pomponius Mela, <hi rend="ital">a geographer of the first century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a treatise</hi> De Situ Orbis.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompō-nĭa</orth>. </sense><sense id="n36987.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of T. Pomponius Atticus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Q. Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36987.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Scipio Africanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:615" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 615</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pompō-nĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Pomponius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pomponian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Atellane poet L. Pomponius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pomposus: <entryFree id="n36988" type="main" key="pompo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pompōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pompa</etym>, <sense id="n36988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemn</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>dignified</tr>, <tr>slow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 3, 23, 7.—</sense><sense id="n36988.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rich</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:34:182" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 34, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 92</bibl>: poëmata, Ven. Carm. 3, 23, 7.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pompōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pompously</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pomptinus: <entryFree id="n36989" type="main" key="Pompti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pomptīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pontīn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n36989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pomptine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appellation given to a district in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Pometia</hi>: ager, Liv. <cb n="POND" /> 6, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:307" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 307</bibl></cit>; and freq. in the <number>plur.</number> paludes, <hi rend="ital">the extensive marshy district exposed to the inundations of the Amasenus and Ufens</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">the Pomptine</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Pontine</hi>) <hi rend="ital">Marshes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 4, 9, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36989.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pomptī-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pomptine district</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde Pomptinum sumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (Baiter).</sense></entryFree>
pomulum: <entryFree id="n36990" type="main" key="po_mu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pomum</etym>, <sense id="n36990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little apple</hi>, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 20.</sense></entryFree>
pomum: <entryFree id="n36991" type="main" key="po_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root pa- of pasco, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n36991.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi> of any kind (apples, cherries, nuts, berries, figs, dates, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:104" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 24, 30, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:113" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 26, 49, § 113</bibl>; 17, 26, 39, § 247; Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <trans><tr>fruit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 812</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 6, 1</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">truffles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:50:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 50, 2</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">grapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:205" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pomis arbores replebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36991.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for pomus, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 426</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pomus: <entryFree id="n36992" type="main" key="po_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n36992.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-tree</hi> of any kind (v. pomum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36992.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for pomum, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pomusculum: <entryFree id="n36993" type="hapax" key="po_muscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōmuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pomum</etym>, <sense id="n36993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, Poët. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 461</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
ponderabilis: <entryFree id="n36994" type="main" key="ponde^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pondero</etym>, <sense id="n36994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be weighed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ponderably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Spec. 20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Spec. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponderale: <entryFree id="n36995" type="gloss" key="ponde^ra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n36995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the public scales</hi>, Inscr. Rein. cl. 7, n. 15; v. ponderarium.</sense></entryFree>
ponderans: <entryFree id="n36996" type="main" key="ponde^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pondero.</entryFree>
ponderarium: <entryFree id="n36997" type="gloss" key="ponde^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pondero</etym>, <sense id="n36997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where public weights are kept and things are weighed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the public scales</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 144</bibl> and 4344.</sense></entryFree>
ponderatio: <entryFree id="n36998" type="main" key="ponde^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n36998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poising</hi> (post-Aug.); <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequā ponderatione confici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus, 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponderator: <entryFree id="n36999" type="main" key="ponde^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pondero</etym>, <sense id="n36999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi> (post-class.): De ponderatoribus, Cod. Th. 7, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 71, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponderator spirituum Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: ponderator, <foreign lang="greek">staqmisth\s h)\ zugosta/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
ponderatura: <entryFree id="n37000" type="gloss" key="ponde^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">staqmo/s</foreign>, ponderatura, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
ponderatus: <entryFree id="n37001" type="main" key="ponde^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pondero.</entryFree>
ponderitas: <entryFree id="n37002" type="hapax" key="ponde^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n37002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weight</hi>: hominis (or nominis), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pondero: <entryFree id="n37003" type="main" key="ponde^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> a thing (syn. examino). </sense><sense id="n37003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper amatorum ponderat illa sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum omnia ponderata confunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 106" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37003.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> in the mind, <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imprimis, quo quisque animo fecerit, ponderandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">momento suo unamquamque rem ponderandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum delectum aurium judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia voluptatibus et doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quisque admiserit non ex crimine, sed ex moribus ejus ... est ponderandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex libidine aut levitate testium causas honestorum hominum ponderari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse fidem ex fortunā ponderandam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 34, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas non ratione, sed verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecil. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia eventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum inventa ponderant et dimetiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 27.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37003.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pon-dĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in a neuter sense, <hi rend="ital">weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">affectu ponderantiore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. ponderatiore).—</sense><sense id="n37003.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">weighed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pondered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well considered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponderatiora beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Fragm. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Fragm. 2</bibl></cit> (v. also under ponderans).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with due consideration</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 36</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrātim</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponderosus: <entryFree id="n37004" type="main" key="ponde^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great</hi> <cb n="POND" /> <hi rend="ital">weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37004.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">compedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana ponderosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 67, § 107</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponderosissimi lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37004.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponderosa epistola,</quote> <trans><tr>weighty</tr>, <tr>significant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>weighty</tr>, <tr>imposing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pondiculum: <entryFree id="n37005" type="main" key="pondi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n37005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small weight</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pondo: <entryFree id="n37006" type="main" key="pondo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><case>abl.</case> from pondus</etym>, <sense id="n37006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in weight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37006.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque piscium ullam unciam hodie pondo cepi,</quote> <trans><tr>an ounce weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exercitus coronam auream dictatori libram pondo decreverit,</quote> <trans><tr>a pound in weight</tr>, <tr>weighing a pound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vettonicae tusae pondo libra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium in pondo libras denarii duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 12, 56, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">styracis, resinae terebinthinae pondo sextantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextarium aquae cum dodrante pondo mellis diluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti in convivio plus pondo quam libras centum inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37006.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with numerals, as the usual measure of weight, as <hi rend="ital">subst. indecl.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pounds</hi> (sc. libra; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): COMPEDIBVS QVINDECIM PONDO ... VINCITO, Fragm. XII. Tabularum: quot pondo te censes esse nudum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri quinque pondo abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti pondo viginti millia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:241" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 42, 97, § 241</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen aureum quinquaginta pondo auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: rettuli auri pondo mille octingentūm septuaginta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona aurea pondo ducentūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 163, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pondus: <entryFree id="n37007" type="main" key="pondus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pondus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pendo</etym>, <sense id="n37007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37007.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37007.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a weight</hi> used in a scale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondera ab Gallis allata iniqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utuntur taleis ferreis ad certum pondus examinatis pro numo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 32</bibl>: pondera publica, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n37007.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the weight of a pound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pound</hi> (very rare for the usual pondo): <cit><quote lang="la">dupondius a duobus ponderibus, quod unum pondus assipondium dicebatur. Id ideo, quod as erat libra pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti pondera quinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:53:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 53, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37007.5" n="1" level="3"> In abstr. </sense><sense id="n37007.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Heaviness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi> of a body: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri gravitate et pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni ponderis saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emere aliquid pondere,</quote> <trans><tr>by weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:197" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 17, 57, § 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in his quae pondere constant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod pondere continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.7" n="b" level="4"> In <number>plur.</number>: pondera, <hi rend="ital">balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipoise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equilibrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendebat in aëre tellus Ponderibus librata suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 57</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 218</bibl> and 6, 574: <cit><quote lang="la">trans pondera (corporis) dextram Porrigere (= ultra libramentum sive aequilibrium corporis),</quote> <trans><tr>out of balance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 380 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 380 sq.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quis libravit in pondere montes et colles in staterā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.8" n="2" level="3"> In concr. </sense><sense id="n37007.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A heavy body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram feruntur omnia suo nutu pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grande auri pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabile pondus auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum argenti pondus expositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris magnum pondus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:648" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 648</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immania pondera baltei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spartani pondera disci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:164:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 164, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the fruit of the womb, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 684</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:96" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 96</bibl> (5, 1, 100); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:151" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 151</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the privy parts,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 77</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37007.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi> (anteclass. and very rare): magnum pondus omnium artificum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 466, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37007.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, etc. (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">momentum): persona non qualiscumque testimonii pondus habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:19:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 19, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave ipsius conscientiae pondus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(honestas) aut sola expetenda est ... aut certe omni pondere gravior habenda quam reliqua omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est maximi momenti et ponderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pondus habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: habet vim in ingenio <pb n="1396" /> <cb n="PONO" /> et pondus in vitā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum pondus accessit ad tollendum dubitationem, judicium et consilium tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is intellegat, hanc meam commendationem magnum apud te pondus habuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is intellegat meas apud te litteras maximum pondus habuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 35, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae litterae maximi sunt apud me ponderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus filius eodem est apud me pondere, quo fuit ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1</bibl></cit>. 1.—Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium verborum ponderibus est utendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula sine pondere et arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 320</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nugis addere pondus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Oppressive weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for onus): <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 951</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:237" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 237</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri ruentis In Venerem tolerare pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara senectae Pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Constantius, insolentiae pondera gravius librans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37007.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weight of character</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla diu femina pondus habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 22: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri reverentia ponderis obstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:289" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaris, tamen cum pondere, virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 246</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pondusculum: <entryFree id="n37008" type="main" key="ponduscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ponduscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n37008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small weight</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cooriatur procella, apprehensi pondusculo lapilli (apes) se librant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pone: <entryFree id="n37009" type="main" key="po_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>for posine, posne; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/matos</foreign>, the last, and v. post</etym>. <sense id="n37009.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, = post, a tergo (opp. ante, before; rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; by Quint., 8, 3, 25, considered as archaic; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: pone gravi sono antiqui utebantur pro loci significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 16</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">(moveri) et ante et pone, ad laevam et ad dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(remiges) Pone petunt, exim referunt ad pectora tonsas, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. tonsam, p. 356 Müll. (Ann. v. 236 Vahl.): pone venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 30</bibl></cit> (4, 14, 28): <cit><quote lang="la">pars cetera pontum Pone legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone subit conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone sequens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:561" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 561</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—With <hi rend="ital">vorsum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>: pone vorsum illac mare est, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 191</bibl> P.; cf. infra <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n37009.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi> (mostly anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pone quos aut ante labantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>;
