cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pone nos recede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone aedem Castoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes Africani pone Veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinctae pone tergum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 85</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pone tergum insurgebat silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam pone verticem submittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">vorsus</hi>: postquam auspicaviatque exercitum adduxi pone vorsus castra hostium, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 191</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pono: <entryFree id="n37010" type="main" key="po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi</itype> (Plaut. posīvi), pŏsĭtum, 3 (old form of <sense id="n37010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> POSEIVEI, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: posivimus, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">posiverunt, Cato, R. R. praef. 1: posiveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 108</bibl>: POSIER<hi rend="ital">unt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5061</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">POSIT, contr. from posivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">732</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1475</bibl>; 3087 al.; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> sync. postus, a, um, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1059</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:965" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 965</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for posno, posino, from old <pos>prep.</pos> port, = <foreign lang="greek">proti/, pro/s</foreign>, and sino; cf.: porricio, pollingo, etc., and v. pro, sino</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set down</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, etc. (syn.: colloco, statuo); constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">adv. of place;</hi> sometimes with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. </sense><sense id="n37010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37010.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas in aerario ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>to pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra iniquo loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia passuum tria ab eorum castris castra ponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: qui indicabantur, in senatu sunt positi, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas obsignatas in publico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sejuges in Capitolio aurati a P. Cornelio positi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannicidae imago in gymnasio ponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum in Pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artus in litore ponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 173</bibl></cit>; and with simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo posuit latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:378" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in curulibus sellis sese posuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>seated themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: hodierno die primum longo <cb n="PONO" /> intervallo in possessionem libertatis pedem ponimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 28</bibl> B. and K. (Klotz, possessione): <cit><quote lang="la">Cyzici in Prytaneum vasa aurea mensae unius posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes erat, quem ... in flammam triplices posuere sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pone feros in ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas in solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam in caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone sub curru nimium propinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esd. 6, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pedem poneret non habebat,</quote> <trans><tr>might set his foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu or genua,</quote> <trans><tr>to bow the knee</tr>, <tr>to kneel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:438" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num genu posuit? num vocem supplicem misit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast one's eyes on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn one's face</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37010.4" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi> a body of troops: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi praesidium ponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem tuendae orae maritimae causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in inscrr., of erecting monuments of any kind: POSVIT, PONENDVM CVRAVIT (usu. abbreviated P. C.), etc.: columna rostrata quae est Duilio in foro posita,</quote> <trans><tr>in honor of Duilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.6" n="3" level="3"> Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> works of art: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcimedon duo pocula fecit ... Orpheaque in medio posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic saxo liquidis ille coloribus Sollers nunc hominem ponere, nunc deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> trees, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: planto, sero): pone ordine vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille et nefasto te (arbor) posuit die,</quote> <trans><tr>planted thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wager</hi>, as a forfeit; <hi rend="ital">to lay down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>, as a prize: pono pallium; <cit><quote lang="la">Ille suum anulum opposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula fagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitat pretiis animos et praemia ponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.9" n="6" level="3"> In business lang., <hi rend="ital">to put out at interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to loan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invest</hi> (less freq. than collocare): pecuniam in praedio ponere, Cic. Tull. § 15 Orell.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Verr. 2:3:70:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives positis in fenore nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam Quaerit Kalendis ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi> a person as a watch or guard, accuser, etc. (less freq. than apponere): <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorigi custodes ponit, ut, quae agat, scire possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos frumento publico est positus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: alicui accusatorem, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer super hoc positus officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.11" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To serve up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set before one</hi> at table (rare for the class. apponere), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posito pavone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 64</bibl>; 2, 8, 91; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 422</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positi Bacchi cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidum scis ponere sumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da Trebio, pone ad Trebium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.12" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay down</hi>, etc. (as clothing, arms, books, the hair or beard, etc., = deponere): <cit><quote lang="la">cum pila ludere vellet tunicamque poneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veste positā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 613</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velamina de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bicolor positis membrana capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros de manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum posui librum, et mecum ipse coepi cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.13" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay out for the grave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toroque Mortua componar, positaeque det oscula frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 644</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to lay in the grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sepelio, condo): corpore posto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ... patriā decedens ponere terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 508</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:480" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 480</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi corpus meum positum fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">IN HAC CVPA MATER ET FILIVS POSITI SVNT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4550</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">HIC POSITVS EST, Inscr. in Boeckh. C. I. Gr. 4156: CINERES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4393</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4489</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.14" n="11" level="3"> Ponere calculum or calculos, transf., <hi rend="ital">to weigh carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene calculum ponas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examina tecum, omnesque, quos ego movi, in utrāque parte calculos pone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37010.15" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <cb n="PONO" /> <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi> (cf. compono): <cit><quote lang="la">qui suas ponunt in statione comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid totiens positas fingis, inepta, comas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 306</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 477</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.16" n="13" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non arbiter Hadriae Major, tollere seu ponere vult freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos cum ponunt aequora motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 14, 31.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, of the winds, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum venti posuere omnisque repente resedit Flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Zephyri posuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac ventus posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n37010.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37010.18" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi> a thing anywhere: noenum ponebat rumores ante salutem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 314 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pone ante oculos laetitiam senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at te apud eum, di boni! quantā in gratiā posui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 6</bibl>; 6, 1, 22: ponite me ei (Appio) in gratiā, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Lentulum ponam te in gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit> B. and K. (Orell. gratiam): <cit><quote lang="la">se quoque in gratiā reconciliatae pacis ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laude positus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in metu non ponere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not to fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum fundamenta in voluptate tamquam in aquā ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in conspectu animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub uno aspectu ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: ponendus est ille ambitus, non abiciendus, <hi rend="ital">to lay down gently</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">close gracefully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:199" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super cor,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay to heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mal. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in crimen populo ponat atque infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Elliptically: et quidem cum in mentem venit, ponor ad scribendum, <hi rend="ital">when it occurs to Cœsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he sets me</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">my name</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to the Senate's decrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.19" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37010.20" n="1" level="3"> Ponere aliquid in aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depend upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibile non est, quantum ego in consiliis et prudentiā tuā, quantum in amore et fide ponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem in aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis auxilium in celeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spem salutis in virtute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in dubio poneret, utrum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>regarded as doubtful</tr>, <tr>doubted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: sed haec haud in magno equidem ponam discrimine, <hi rend="ital">I shall attach no great importance to it</hi>, id. prooem. § 8.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: positum esse in aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to be based</hi> or <hi rend="ital">founded upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depend upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salutem praesentium, spem reliquorum in vestris sententiis positam esse et defixam putetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia posita putamus in Planci tui liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, F, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te positum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, § 8. —</sense><sense id="n37010.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi> a thing, esp. time, in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in cogitatione ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in hac curā vita mihi ponenda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem totum in considerandā causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum animum atque omnem curam, operam diligentiamque suam in petitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id multo tum faciemus liberius totosque nos in contemplandis rebus perspiciendisque ponemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud gratissimum hominem beneficium ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera enim ita facit, ut multos dies in oppidum ponat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.22" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> a thing in or among certain things: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem in malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in beneficii loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis motus populi factus esset, id C. Norbano in fraude capitali esse ponendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laude,</quote> <trans><tr>to regard as praiseworthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitiis poni,</quote> <trans><tr>to be regarded as a fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.23" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festos laetosque ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut male posuimus initia, sic cetera sequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu in spem ponas me bonae frugi fore,</quote> <trans><tr>to hope for</tr>, <tr>reckon upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit> Fleck.: nomen, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give a name</hi> (= imponere): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim rebus novis nova ponenda nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi nomen Insano posuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: rationem, <hi rend="ital">to furnish an account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1397" /> <cb n="PONS" /> <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.24" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">render</hi> vows or votive offerings to the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri ponere vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego victrices lauro redimire tabellas, Nec Veneris mediā ponere in aede morer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ponite lucida Funalia et vectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libatum agricolae ponitur ante deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 506</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praedā tripodem aureum Delphi posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.25" n="6" level="3"> In speaking or writing, <hi rend="ital">to lay down as true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take for granted</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem, ut paulo ante posui, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte Magnus ille noster, me audiente, posuit in judicio, rem publicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: verum pono, esse victum eum; <cit><quote lang="la">at, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positum sit igitur in primis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc posito atque concesso, esse quandam vim divinam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo posito, et omnium sensu adprobato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pono satis in eo fuisse orationis atque ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro certo ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc rem ipsam ponamus quam illi non negant ... Est haec res posita, quae ab adversario non negatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 11, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.26" n="7" level="3"> Esp.: exemplum ponere, <hi rend="ital">to cite an instance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum quae constant exempla ponemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:38:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 38, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuo et grandi vitio praeditum posuimus exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab adjunctis antea posui exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 11, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum exempla posui ex jure civili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum generum ex Cicerone exempla ponamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:108 al" default="NO">6, 3, 108 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37010.27" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set before the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ponere lucum Artifices, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:70" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone Tigellinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.28" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix upon</hi> a theme for discussion (= proponere): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nunc vos quaestiunculam, de quā meo arbitratu loquar, ponitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere aliquid, ad quod audiam, si tibi non est molestum, volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere jubebam, de quo quis audire vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctorum est ista consuetudo eaque Graecorum, ut iis ponatur, de quo disputent quamvis subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Lael. 5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita positum esset, videri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Tusc. 3:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.29" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forego</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi> (= deponere): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam propera ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 66</bibl></cit>: inimicitias, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 12, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:816" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 816</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda ferocia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires (flammae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum rudimentum adulescentiae bello lacessentem Romanos posuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>had obtained his first experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">tirocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay down life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>.—Esp., milit. t. t.: arma ponere (= deponere), <hi rend="ital">to lay down arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nepesinis inde edictum ut arma ponant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedi imperatorem, arma poni jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">positis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37010.30" n="11" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to be</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cornu tuum ponam ferreum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mich. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posuit me desolatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thren. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponam Samariam quasi acervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mich. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posuerunt eam in ruinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 23, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37010.31" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> a case (of mere suppositions; only late Lat.; cf. 6 supra): pone tamen ab evangelistis scriptum, Ambros. de Fide, 5, 16, 194; Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 273" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 273</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, of localities, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated; situate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma in montibus posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos in Aegaeo mari posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus ex adverso urbi positus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus opportune ad id positus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs alieno solo posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno positus = sopitus,</quote> <trans><tr>lulled to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 527</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pons: <entryFree id="n37011" type="main" key="pons1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pons</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. pathi, a path; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/tos</foreign>; old Germ. phat, pfat; mod. Germ. Pfad; Angl.-Sax. padh; hence prop. a board across a ditch, brook, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n37011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bridge</hi> across a river, ditch, or marsh, between towers, etc. </sense><sense id="n37011.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars oppidi mari disjuncta angusto, ponte rursus adjungitur et continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PONT" /> 52, § <cit><quote lang="la">117: pontem in Arare faciendum curat,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw a bridge over the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: in Isarā, flumine maximo, ponte uno die facto, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Histro flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inicere pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen ponte jungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem ponte junxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere pontem flumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontibus palude constratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem navibus efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponte flumen transgredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: ponte flumen transmittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ponte flumen traicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interscindere pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">rescindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 66</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem pontis rescindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as a stand for beggars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis de ponte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a beggar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 134</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures dies efficiendis pontibus absumpti,</quote> <trans><tr>a bridge of several spans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 18, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37011.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37011.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bridge at the Comitia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over which the voters passed one by one to the</hi> septum, <hi rend="ital">to deposit their votes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:634" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 634</bibl>. Hence the proverb: sexagenarios de ponte; v. sexagenarius.—</sense><sense id="n37011.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden drawbridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be let down from besieging towers to the walls of a town</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37011.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plank bridge thrown from a vessel to the shore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 288</bibl> and 654; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37011.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The deck of a ship on which the military engines were placed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37011.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A floor of a tower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 530</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 675</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37011.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden bridge on a narrow wall between two towers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37012" type="main" key="Pons2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pons</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a geographical proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37012.1" n="I" level="1"> Pons Argenteus, the modern <hi rend="ital">Argens</hi>, Lepid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37012.2" n="II" level="1"> Pons Campanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37012.3" n="III" level="1"> Aureoli, the modern <hi rend="ital">Pontiruolo</hi>, Trebell. XXX. Tyr. Aureol. al.</sense></entryFree>
pontia: <entryFree id="n37013" type="main" key="Ponti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman notorious as the poisoner of her own children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:638" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:34:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 34, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:43:5" default="NO">4, 43, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:75:3" default="NO">6, 75, 3</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37014" type="main" key="Pontia2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ponti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n37014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tuscan Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ponza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the group of little islands which includes Ponza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 3, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponticulus: <entryFree id="n37015" type="main" key="ponti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. pons</etym>, <sense id="n37015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 598</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponticus: <entryFree id="n37016" type="main" key="Ponti^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Pontus, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37017" type="main" key="Ponti^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Propertius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Trist. 4, 10, 47</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:21 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 16, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
pontifex: <entryFree id="n37018" type="main" key="ponti^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pontŭ-</orth>), <itype>fĭcis</itype> <etym>doubtless from pons-facio; but the original meaning is obscure</etym>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman high-priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pontiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pontifex</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antistes, sacerdos): pontifices, ut Q. Scaevola pontifex maximus dicebat, a posse et facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl>, on the laws of the Twelve Tables; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:454" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 454</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:604" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 604</bibl>. Their <hi rend="ital">chief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">president</hi> was called Pontifex Maximus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5</bibl> et saep.: MAIOR VESTAE, Inscr. (a. 353 p. Chr. n.) Orell. 3184: pontifices minores, <hi rend="ital">a lower class of pontiffs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sub- pontiffs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribae pontificis, quos nunc minores pontifices appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 6, 12</bibl>; Verr. Fl. Fast. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 408</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Inscr. Cenot. Pisan. ap. Orell. 643: pontifices seu minores seu maximi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37018.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37018.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Jewish high-priest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontifex, id est, sacerdos maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caiapham pontificem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 18, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37018.3" n="B" level="2"> In the Christian period, <hi rend="ital">a bishop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pontificalis: <entryFree id="n37019" type="main" key="ponti^fi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pontifex</etym>, <sense id="n37019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pontifex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pontifical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honos,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Pontifex Maximus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:420" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 420</bibl></cit>: ludi, <hi rend="ital">given by the</hi> Pontifex Maximus <cb n="POPA" /> <hi rend="ital">on his entrance into office</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pontificatus: <entryFree id="n37020" type="main" key="ponti^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pontifex</etym>, <sense id="n37020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of a pontifex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pontificate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>: pontificatus maximus. <hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> Pontifex Maximus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pontificius: <entryFree id="n37021" type="main" key="ponti^fi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pontifex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pontifical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl>: jus, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37021.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37021.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfĭcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. libri), <hi rend="ital">the pontifical books</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37021.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37021.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dignity of a pontiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of a bishop</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cod. Th. 16, 5, 13.—</sense><sense id="n37021.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right</hi> of doing any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">is, cujus negotium id pontificiumque esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 8, 18, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:10:44" default="NO">10, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pontilis: <entryFree id="n37022" type="main" key="ponti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pons</etym>, <sense id="n37022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a bridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bridge-</hi> (post-class.): stratus, perh. <hi rend="ital">a wooden floor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
pontinus: <entryFree id="n37023" type="main" key="Ponti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pomptinus.</entryFree>
pontius: <entryFree id="n37024" type="main" key="Ponti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">originally Samnite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards Roman.</hi> So, </sense><sense id="n37024.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Pontius, <hi rend="ital">a leader of the Samnites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who surrounded the Romans in the Caudine Pass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37024.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Pontius Aquila, <hi rend="ital">one of the assassins of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 14</bibl>; Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37024.3" n="III" level="1"> Pontius Pilatus, <hi rend="ital">governor of Judœa in the time of Christ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18</bibl>; Sed. Carm. 5, 116.</sense></entryFree>
pontivagus: <entryFree id="n37025" type="hapax" key="ponti^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pontusvagor</etym>, <sense id="n37025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roaming over the sea; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who sails over the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a voyager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">navigator</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 487</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ponto: <entryFree id="n37026" type="main" key="ponto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ponto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. pons</etym>. <sense id="n37026.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of Gallic transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a punt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37026.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A floating bridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pontoon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pontonium: <entryFree id="n37027" type="gloss" key="pontoni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontonĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ponto</etym>, <sense id="n37027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small punt</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pontus: <entryFree id="n37028" type="greek" key="pontus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pontus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/ntos</foreign>. <sense id="n37028.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for mare): mulserat huc navem pontus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 257 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">placidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus Libyae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum undique et undique pontus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 193</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:772" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 772</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 469</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">freta ponti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37028.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. * </sense><sense id="n37028.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 377</bibl></cit> (a poetic pleonasm, like the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">po/ntos a(lo\s polih=s</foreign>, Il. 21, 59).—* </sense><sense id="n37028.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wave of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-wave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens a vertice pontus In puppim ferit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37029" type="main" key="Pontus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*po/ntos</foreign>. <sense id="n37029.0" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Black Sea</hi>, called in full Pontus Euxinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:1" default="NO">1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:180 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 180 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37029.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the region about the Black Sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medea ex eodem Ponto profugisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37029.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a district in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Bithynia and Armenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the kingdom of Mithridates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards a Roman province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:8 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 8 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pontic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of hazel-nuts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mures,</quote> <trans><tr>ermines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 37, 55, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:200" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 73, 93, § 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <trans><tr>the dragon that watched the golden fleece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <trans><tr>rhubarb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Rha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponticus genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 2</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37029.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the province of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:23" default="NO">23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37029.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pontĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = 2. Pontus, <hi rend="ital">the Black Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
popa: <entryFree id="n37030" type="main" key="po^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n37030.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman inferior priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a priest's assistant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">minister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who brought the victim to the altar and felled it with an axe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 120</bibl>. Alluding to the corpulence of such priests: <cit><quote lang="la">popa venter,</quote> <trans><tr>a fat paunch</tr>, <tr>glutton</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 74</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37030.1" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: PHILEMA POPA DE INSVLA, perh. = <hi rend="ital">she who sells animals for sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2457</bibl>. <pb n="1398" /> <cb n="POPP" /></sense></entryFree>
popanum: <entryFree id="n37031" type="greek" key="po^pa^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/panon</foreign>, <sense id="n37031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificial cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:541" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 541</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
popellus: <entryFree id="n37032" type="main" key="po^pellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>populus</etym>, <sense id="n37032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rabble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">populace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
popilia: <entryFree id="n37033" type="main" key="Popili^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Popilĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Popill-</orth>), <itype>tribus</itype>, v. Poblilia.</entryFree>
popilius: <entryFree id="n37034" type="main" key="Popi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Popĭlĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Popill-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Popi-lĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Popill-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So esp., </sense><sense id="n37034.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Popillius Laenas, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> A. U.C. 395, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37034.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Popilius Laenas, <hi rend="ital">the assassin of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37034.3" n="3" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Popilia,</quote> <trans><tr>the wife of Q.
