Catulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 44</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n37034.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Popĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Popilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Popilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
popina: <entryFree id="n37035" type="main" key="po^pi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pe/pw, pe/ptw</foreign>, to cook</etym>, <sense id="n37035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook-shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victualling-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating-house</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">caupona, taberna): bibitur, estur, quasi in popinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:70:3" default="NO">5, 70, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:81" default="NO">11, 81</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37035.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the food sold at a cookshop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si epulae potius quam popinae nominandae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taeterrimam popinam inhalare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
popinalis: <entryFree id="n37036" type="main" key="po^pi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>popina</etym>, <sense id="n37036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cook-shop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 201, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
popinarius: <entryFree id="n37037" type="main" key="po^pi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victualler</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Firm. Math. 4, 15.</sense></entryFree>
popinator: <entryFree id="n37038" type="main" key="po^pi_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frequenter of cook-shops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gormandizer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 14</bibl>; cf. popino.</sense></entryFree>
popino: <entryFree id="n37039" type="main" key="po^pi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frequenter of eating - houses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gormandizer</hi>, Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 161, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
popinor: <entryFree id="n37040" type="main" key="po^pi_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpīnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n37040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to frequent eating-houses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gormandize</hi> (post-class.): dum Gallienus popinatur, Trebell. XXX. Tyr. 29.</sense></entryFree>
poples: <entryFree id="n37041" type="main" key="pople^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poplĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n37041.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">the ham of the knee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hough</hi> (cf. suffrago): <cit><quote lang="la">genua poplitesque et crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succisis feminibus poplitibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succiso poplite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 762</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 48, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephas poplites intus flectit hominis modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:59" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 17, § 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37041.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the knee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 771</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:953" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 953</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplicato poplite,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with bended knee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 927</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se collegit in arma poplite subsidens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contento poplite,</quote> <trans><tr>with a stiff knee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec parcit imbellis juventae Poplitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poplitibus semet excipit,</quote> <trans><tr>he sank down upon his knees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexo poplite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poplicitus: <entryFree id="n37042" type="main" key="popli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poplĭcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. publicitus.</entryFree>
poplicula: <entryFree id="n37043" type="main" key="Popli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poplĭcŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Poplĭcŏla</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭ-cŏla</orth> (the very ancient inscr. in Orell. 547 has POPLICVLA, the palimpsest of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>, twice Publicola), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. populus-colo</etym> (a favorer or friend of the people), <sense id="n37043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> P. Valerius, <hi rend="ital">and of his descendants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 547</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde cognomen factum Publicolae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poplicola, ingentis Volesi Spartana propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 480, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poplicola atque Corvinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, as an appellative, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poplicus: <entryFree id="n37044" type="main" key="popli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poplĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. publicus.</entryFree>
poplifugia: <entryFree id="n37045" type="main" key="Po^pli^fu^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏplĭfŭgĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭ-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. populus-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n37045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival in memory of the people's flight to the rescue of the Latins</hi>, celebrated on the nones of July, POPLIF. NP., Calend. Maff. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 394</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, § 18</bibl>; Piso ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poplus: <entryFree id="n37046" type="main" key="poplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poplus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. populus <sense id="n37046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
poppaeus: <entryFree id="n37047" type="main" key="Poppaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poppaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poppaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n37047.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, Poppaeus Sabinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 39: Poppaeus Silvanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37047.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poppaea (on inscrr. also Poppea and Poppaia) Sabina,</quote> <trans><tr>wife of the emperor Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 731</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">733</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arval. ap. Marin. tab. XVII. b, p. 123.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37047.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poppaeā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">named after Poppœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Poppœan</hi>: pinguia, <hi rend="ital">a species of cosmetic</hi> (bread-dough mixed with asses' milk), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:465" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 465</bibl>. <cb n="POPU" /></sense></entryFree>
poppysma: <entryFree id="n37048" type="greek" key="poppysma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poppysma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">poppys-mus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/ppusma</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">poppusmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n37048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smacking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clucking with the tongue</hi>, as a sign of approbation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:584" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 584</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on occasion of lightning, as a religious ceremony,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a similar sound,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:18:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 18, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poppysmus: <entryFree id="n37049" type="main" key="poppysmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poppysmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. poppysma.</entryFree>
poppyzon: <entryFree id="n37050" type="greek" key="poppy_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poppȳzon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poppu/zwn</foreign>, <sense id="n37050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who clucks with the tongue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pingeret poppyzonta retinentem equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populabilis: <entryFree id="n37051" type="main" key="po^pu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>populor</etym>, <sense id="n37051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be laid waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ravaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructible</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quodcunque fuit populabile flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 262</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populabundus: <entryFree id="n37052" type="main" key="po^pu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi> (rare): agros populabundus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 23</bibl>; cf.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fines Romanos excurrerunt populabundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagari populandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul per agrum populabundus ierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
popularia: <entryFree id="n37053" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. popularis, I. B.</entryFree>
popularis: <entryFree id="n37054" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlāris</orth> (sync. poplāris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 36</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceeding from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designed for the people.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37054.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">populares leges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>laws instituted by the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <trans><tr>a donation to the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularia verba usitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad usum popularem atque civilem disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio ad vulgarem popularemque sensum accommodata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio philosophorum ... nec sententiis nec verbis instructa popularibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populari nomine aliquid appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <trans><tr>in the mouths of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>popular favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 130 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <trans><tr>democracy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl></cit> (opp. regia civitas, <hi rend="ital">monarchy</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">popularia sacra sunt, ut ait Labeo, quae omnes cives faciunt nec certis familiis attributa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p.253</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37054.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. subsellia), <hi rend="ital">the seats of the people in the theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the common seats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37054.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37054.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the same people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigenous</hi> (as an adj. rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Sappho puellis de popularibus querentem vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <trans><tr>of the same district</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <trans><tr>native</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 498</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.5" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n37054.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-countryman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire ad suos populares, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. stuprum, p. 317 Müll.: o mi popularis, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o populares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis ac sodalis suus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero Solonis, popularis tui, ut puto, etiam mei, legem neglegam (for Cicero had also lived in Athens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis alicujus definiti loci (opp. civis totius mundi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non populares modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum turbā popularium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: quae res indicabat populares esse.—</sense><sense id="n37054.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea popularis opsecro haec est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37054.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Of animals and plants of the same region: <cit><quote lang="la">leaena, Ov. lb. 503: (glires) populares ejusdem silvae (opp. alienigenae, amne vel monte discreti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populares eorum (prunorum) myxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Of persons of the same condition, occupation, tastes, etc., <hi rend="ital">a companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>: meus popularis Geta, <hi rend="ital">fellow</hi> (i. e. a slave), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populares conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:14" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: invitis hoc nostris popularibus dicam, <hi rend="ital">the men of our school</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Stoics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.11" n="B" level="2"> In a political signification, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devoted to the people</hi> (as opposed to the nobility), <hi rend="ital">popular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">democratic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica ex tribus generibus illis, regali et optumati et populari confusa modice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 41</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 31</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">homo maxime popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul veritate non ostentatione popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: animus vere popularis,<cb n="POPU" />  saluti populi consulens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos, i. e. Clodius, as attached to the popular party,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: homo, <hi rend="ital">of the common people</hi> (opp. rex), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 11</bibl>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people's party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the democrats</hi> (opp. optimates, the aristocrats): <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera semper in hac civitate fuerunt . . . quibus ex generibus alteri se populares, alteri optimates et haberi et esse voluerunt. Quia ea quae faciebant, multitudini jucunda esse volebant, populares habebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui populares habebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo evenit, ut alii populares, alii studiosi optimi cujusque videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Acceptable to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable to the multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi in senatu me popularem consulem futurum. Quid enim est tam populare quam pax?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest nihil esse tam populare quam id quod ego consul popularis adfero, pacem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nihil popularius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populare gratumque audientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Paneg. 77:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Paneg. 77, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.13" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the citizens</hi> (as opposed to the soldiery): <cit><quote lang="la">quique rem agunt duelli, quique populare auspicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg.2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.<bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10</bibl>; usually as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">popŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a citizen</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa milia et popularium et militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. Phil. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 12, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularibus militibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:26:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 26, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.14" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fit for the common people;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>: sal. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli (apium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: popularia agere, <hi rend="ital">to play coarse tricks</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 25</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlārĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n37054.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">After the manner of the common people</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">commonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgarly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptus liber (opp. limatius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37054.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In a popular manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">democratically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciones seditiose ac populariter excitatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidere quemlibet populariter,</quote> <trans><tr>to win popularity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
popularitas: <entryFree id="n37055" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>popularis</etym>. * <sense id="n37055.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to popularis, II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A being of the same country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-citizenship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularitatis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37055.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to popularis, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Popularity</hi>, but only subjectively, <hi rend="ital">an effort to please the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a courting of popular favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular bearing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid popularitatis praetermitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto rarior apud Tiberium popularitas, tanto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus popularitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:69" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37055.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the population</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populariter: <entryFree id="n37056" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. popularis <sense id="n37056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
populatim: <entryFree id="n37057" type="main" key="po^pu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from people to people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among all nations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universally</hi> (ante-class.): poëta placuit populatim omnibus, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 20</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 154, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populatio: <entryFree id="n37058" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>populor</etym>, <sense id="n37058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastation</hi>, etc. (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n37058.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">populationem effuse facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">populationibus incursionibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem rapinis, pabulationibus populationibusque prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37058.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37058.3" n="1" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">things plundered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes pleni populationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37058.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroying</hi> done by animals: <cit><quote lang="la">a populatione murium formicarumque frumenta defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37058.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 34, 53, § 104</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">ruin through luxury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37059" type="main" key="po^pu^la_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">population;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">flebat populatio praesens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populator: <entryFree id="n37060" type="main" key="po^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>populor</etym>, <sense id="n37060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a devastator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37060.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae (Atrides),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 655</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tuscae glandis aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:27:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calabri arvi Sirius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:683" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 683</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37060.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus populator opum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populatrix: <entryFree id="n37061" type="main" key="po^pu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>populator</etym>, <sense id="n37061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that</hi> <pb n="1399" /> <cb n="POPU" /> <hi rend="ital">wastes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroys</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi populatrix virgo profundi, i. e. Scylla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 167</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populatrix Hymetti, apis,</quote> <trans><tr>a rifler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:104" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populatus: <entryFree id="n37062" type="main" key="po^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>populor</etym>, <sense id="n37062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a devastating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 634</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalent populatibus agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcere populatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3, p. 181, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populetum: <entryFree id="n37063" type="main" key="po_pu^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpŭlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poplar wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populeus: <entryFree id="n37064" type="main" key="po_pu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to poplars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poplar-</hi>: frus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 5, 160</bibl> (Ann. v. 562 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 190</bibl>; cf. Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 21, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1641" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1641</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populifer: <entryFree id="n37065" type="main" key="po_pu^li^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpŭlĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. populusfero</etym>, <sense id="n37065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poplar-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Padus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose banks abound with poplars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spercheos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 579</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populifugia: <entryFree id="n37066" type="main" key="Po^pu^li^fu^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlĭfŭgĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Poplifugia.</entryFree>
populiscitum: <entryFree id="n37067" type="main" key="po^pu^lisci_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭliscītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or better written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭli scītum</orth>, <sense id="n37067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decree of the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses nihil nisi populi scitis ac decretis agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populiscito in patriam restitutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitum populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populito: <entryFree id="n37068" type="hapax" key="po^pu^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>populor</etym>, <sense id="n37068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. popularentur).</sense></entryFree>
populneus: <entryFree id="n37069" type="main" key="po_pulne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpulnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of poplars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poplar-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. populeus.</sense></entryFree>
populnus: <entryFree id="n37070" type="hapax" key="po_pulnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpulnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of poplars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poplar-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populo: <entryFree id="n37071" type="main" key="po^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. populor.</entryFree>
populonia: <entryFree id="n37072" type="main" key="Po^pu^lo_ni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>populor</etym> (she who protects against devastation), <sense id="n37072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Juno</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>; Sen. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37073" type="main" key="Po^pu^lo_ni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlō-nĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlōnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Etruria</hi>, now the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Poplonia</hi>, near <hi rend="ital">Piombino.</hi>—Form Populonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Populonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Populonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37073.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏpŭlōnĭen-ses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Populonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Populonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populor: <entryFree id="n37074" type="main" key="po^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, 1. <pos>v. dep.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. populus; prop. to spread or pour out in a multitude over a region; hence, transf. to the result</etym>, <sense id="n37074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolate; to spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi> (class.; syn.: vasto, vexo, diripio). </sense><sense id="n37074.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37074.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form populor: Romanus exercitus insulam integram urit, populatur, vastat, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 90, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu populabatur agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remorum agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva ferro populatur et igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 445</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omnia igni ferroque populatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules Aequos populantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n37074.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form populo (in Cicero only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>): patriam populavit meam, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 32</bibl>: agrum populare coeperunt, Quadrig. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 471, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora vestra Vi populat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 527</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romanam deūm irā morbo populari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populata vexataque provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi nunc populati atque vexati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva Marte populata nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populatis messibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:55:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37074.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in the active form), Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">populatque ingentem farris acervum Curculio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feris populandas tradere gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populata tempora raptis Auribus,</quote> <trans><tr>mutilated</tr>, <tr>deprived of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populatum exspuit hamum,</quote> <trans><tr>robbed of the bait</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 36</bibl></cit>.—In a deponent form: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque suum populatus iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:445" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam populabitur aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ventus in Aetnā) Putria multivagis populatur flatibus antra,</quote> <trans><tr>lays waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populositas: <entryFree id="n37075" type="main" key="po^pu^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlōsĭtas</orth>, ātis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>populosus</etym>, <sense id="n37075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PORC" /> p. 102: <cit><quote lang="la">luminum Argi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
populosus: <entryFree id="n37076" type="main" key="po^pu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. populus</etym>, <sense id="n37076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">populous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numerous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gens populosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 5, p. 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Briareus populoso corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: populosior globus, Veg.Mil. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula populosissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
populus: <entryFree id="n37077" type="main" key="po^pu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏpŭlus</orth> (contr. POPLVS, Inscr. Column. Rostr. in Corp. Inscr. Lat. 195, 17, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 6</bibl> et saep.—Also written POPOLVS, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 197, 15 al.; <sense id="n37077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> poploe, Carm. Sal. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.; v. pilumnoe) [from root pleof pleo; v. plenus], <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the people.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37077.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37077.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens, natio): res publica res populi: populus autem non omnis hominum coetus quoquo modo congregatus, sed coetus multitudinis juris consensu et utilitatis communione sociatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: exspectabat populus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 90 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tene magis salvum populus velit an populum tu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: casci populi Latini, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 24 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hi populi: Atellani, Calatini, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37077.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n37077.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The people</hi>, opp. to the Senate, in the formula senatus populusque Romanus (abbreviated S. P. Q. R.), saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et patres in populi fore potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37077.5" n="2" level="3"> Opp. to the plebs: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim populi, sed plebis eum (tribunum) magistratum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea res populo plebique Romanae bene eveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37077.6" n="3" level="3"> Rarely for plebs, <hi rend="ital">the populace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat populus, dat gratus eques, dat tura senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: urbanus, <hi rend="ital">the citizens</hi> (opp. to the military), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37077.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37077.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, regarded as inhabited: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens cultoribus alius populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dh=mos</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n37077.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great number</hi> of persons or things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ratis populo peritura recepto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the great multitude of passengers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanto populo sileri parricidium potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus totidem imaginum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus in forum populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37077.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The public</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the open street</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): omnis habet geminas janua frontis, E quibus haec populum spectat; <cit><quote lang="la">at illa Larem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:136" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37078" type="main" key="po_pu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root pamp-, pap-, to swell; Lat. papula, papilla, pampinus</etym>, <sense id="n37078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poplar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poplar-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:78" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 11, 15, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sacred to Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba,</quote> <trans><tr>the silver-poplar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
por: <entryFree id="n37079" type="main" key="por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">por</orth>, <itype>for puer</itype>, i. e. servus; <sense id="n37079.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">e. g. Marcipor, Lucipor, etc., i. e. servus Marci, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6</bibl></cit>.—Thus also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pora</orth> <itype>for puera</itype>, i. e. serva, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> Class. 17</bibl>, n. 180.</sense></entryFree>
porca: <entryFree id="n37080" type="main" key="porca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porcus</etym>, <sense id="n37080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 26</bibl>.— By <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license for <hi rend="ital">a male swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 641</bibl> Serv.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37081" type="main" key="porca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. O. H. Germ. furh; Germ. Furche; Engl. furrow</etym>, <sense id="n37081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ridge between two furrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a balk</hi> (cf. lira), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 44</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37081.1" n="B" level="2"> In Spain, <hi rend="ital">a measure of land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcarius: <entryFree id="n37082" type="main" key="porca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>porcus, porca</etym>, <sense id="n37082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulva,</quote> <trans><tr>that has farrowed properly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37082.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">porcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a swine-herd</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6, 6.</sense></entryFree>
porcastrum: <entryFree id="n37083" type="main" key="porcastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> portulaca, <hi rend="ital">purslain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcella: <entryFree id="n37084" type="main" key="porcella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcella</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porcula</etym>, <sense id="n37084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little female pig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcellinus: <entryFree id="n37085" type="main" key="porcelli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcellīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>porcellus</etym>, <sense id="n37085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of young swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pig-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: caro, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 6.</sense></entryFree>
porcellio: <entryFree id="n37086" type="main" key="porcelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheslip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woodlouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sowbug</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:119" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 119</bibl>; Pelag. Vet. 5.</sense></entryFree>
porcellus: <entryFree id="n37087" type="main" key="porcellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porculus</etym>, <sense id="n37087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; Plin. <cb n="PORP" /> 30, 6, 16, § 47.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the litter</hi> of a wild sow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porceo: <entryFree id="n37088" type="main" key="porceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porceo</orth> (PORXI, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 217</bibl> P., without any example). <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>porro-arceo</etym>, <sense id="n37088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi> (ante-class.): porcet quoque dictum ab antiquis quasi porro arcet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">porcet significat prohibet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 159, 33</bibl></cit>: non te porro procedere porcent, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 9</bibl>: civium porcet pudor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 160, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 369 Vahl.); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 160, 8</bibl>; Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 160, 2</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
porcetra: <entryFree id="n37089" type="main" key="porce_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porca</etym>, <sense id="n37089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sow that has once littered</hi>, Meliss. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcilaca: <entryFree id="n37090" type="main" key="porci^la_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcĭlāca</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">porcillāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for portulaca, <sense id="n37090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purslain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 20, 81, § 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcilia: <entryFree id="n37091" type="gloss" key="porcili^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcilĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porca</etym>, <sense id="n37091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young sow</hi>, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. n. 41, lin. 22; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porciliaris: <entryFree id="n37092" type="gloss" key="porcili^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcilĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>porcilia</etym>, <sense id="n37092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a young sow</hi>: extae, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. n. 41, lin. 18.</sense></entryFree>
porcinarium: <entryFree id="n37093" type="gloss" key="porci_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>porcus</etym>, <sense id="n37093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pigsty</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">u(oforbei=on</foreign>, porcinarium, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
porcinarius: <entryFree id="n37094" type="hapax" key="porci_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a porkseller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcinus: <entryFree id="n37095" type="main" key="porci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n37095.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of a hog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hog's</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swine's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">polimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Frag. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro, porcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37095.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">porcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">swine's flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37095.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in milit. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">porcinum caput,</quote> <trans><tr>a swine's head</tr>, <tr>a wedge-shaped order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
porcius: <entryFree id="n37096" type="main" key="Porcius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porcius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Porcia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. The most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n37096.1" n="A" level="2"> M. Porcius Cato Censorinus, or Major, <hi rend="ital">the severe censor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life was written by Nepos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and for whom Cicero named his Essay on Old Age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37096.2" n="B" level="2"> M. Porcius Cato, <hi rend="ital">the younger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called Uticensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because of his famous death at Utica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Cat. 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 12, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37096.3" n="C" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Porcia, <hi rend="ital">a sister of the younger Cato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Domitius Ahenobarbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37096.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Porcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Porcius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Porcian</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">of the people's tribune</hi> P. Porcius Laeca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilica,</quote> <trans><tr>named after the elder Cato</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porcula: <entryFree id="n37097" type="main" key="porcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porca</etym>, <sense id="n37097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sow</hi>, v. l. for porcella, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porculatio: <entryFree id="n37098" type="hapax" key="porcu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porculus</etym>, <sense id="n37098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swinebreeding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porculator: <entryFree id="n37099" type="main" key="porcu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who rears young swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swine-breeder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § 26; 7, 9, 12.</sense></entryFree>
porculetum: <entryFree id="n37100" type="main" key="porcu^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcŭlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>porca, II.</etym>, <sense id="n37100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field divided into beds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porculus: <entryFree id="n37101" type="main" key="porcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porcus</etym>. <sense id="n37101.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a young swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young pig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a porker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porkling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37101.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37101.2" n="A" level="2"> Porculus marinus, <hi rend="ital">a sea-hog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porpoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37101.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hook in a wine</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">oil-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porcus: <entryFree id="n37102" type="main" key="porcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/rkos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 97</bibl> Müll.; Umbr. purka, O. H. Germ. farah</etym>. <sense id="n37102.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tame swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pig</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt domi agni, et porci sacres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa abundat porco, haedo, agno, gallinā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scrofa alat suos porcos,</quote> <trans><tr>her pigs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus femina,</quote> <trans><tr>a female swine</tr>, <tr>sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl>.—Of a glutton, as a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">hog</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37102.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37102.2" n="A" level="2"> Porcus marinus, <hi rend="ital">the sea-hog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porpoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 19, § 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called simply porcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37102.3" n="B" level="2"> = pudendum muliebre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37102.4" n="C" level="2"> Caput porci, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a wedge-shaped order of battle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13</bibl>; cf. porcinus, II.</sense></entryFree>
porgo: <entryFree id="n37103" type="main" key="porgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. porrigo <sense id="n37103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
