porphyreticus: <entryFree id="n37104" type="greek" key="porphy^re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porphyrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">porfu/ra</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n37104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purple-red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porphyretic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae, Capitol. in Anton. Pio, 11: tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 53, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porphyrio: <entryFree id="n37105" type="greek" key="porphy^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porphyrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">porfuri/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n37105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of water-fowl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sultana-hen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porphyrton</hi><pb n="1400" /> <cb n="PORR" />  (Fulica porphyrio, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 16, 63, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porphyrion: <entryFree id="n37106" type="main" key="Porphy^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porphyrĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*porfuri/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n37106.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the giants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:78:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 78, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigant. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37106.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient commentator on Horace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
porphyrites: <entryFree id="n37107" type="greek" key="porphy^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porphyrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">porfuri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n37107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purple-colored precious stone in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porphyry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porphyritis: <entryFree id="n37108" type="greek" key="porphy^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porphyrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n37108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">porfuri=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">purple-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porraceus: <entryFree id="n37109" type="main" key="porra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>porrum</etym>. <sense id="n37109.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of leeks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 70, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37109.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like leeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leek-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porrecte: <entryFree id="n37110" type="main" key="porrecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. porrigo, <sense id="n37110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
porrectio: <entryFree id="n37111" type="main" key="porrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. porrigo</etym>, <sense id="n37111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum (opp. contractio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37111.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a straight line</hi> (opp. circinatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porrectus: <entryFree id="n37112" type="main" key="porrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. porrigo.</entryFree>
porriciae: <entryFree id="n37113" type="main" key="porri^ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrĭcĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porricio</etym>, <sense id="n37113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the parts of the victim consecrated to the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificial pieces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 231</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> (al. prosiciae).</sense></entryFree>
porricio: <entryFree id="n37114" type="main" key="porri^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">porĭ-</orth>), <itype>ēci, ectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>old <pos>prep.</pos> port (v. pōno) and root ric-, to extend; cf. rica, a flowing veil</etym>. <sense id="n37114.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer sacrifice to the gods</hi>: exta porriciunto, diis danto in altaria, Veran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>: atrocia porriciunt exta ministratores, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 76, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruda exta in mare porricit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extaque salsos Porriciam in fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 238</bibl></cit> and 776; Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 21</bibl>.—Prov.: inter caesa et porrecta ut aiunt, <hi rend="ital">between the slaying and the offering of the victim</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the last moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the eleventh hour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n37114.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, apart from relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">seges frumentum porricit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
porriginosus: <entryFree id="n37115" type="main" key="porri_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. porrigo</etym>, <sense id="n37115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of dandruff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurvy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porrigo: <entryFree id="n37116" type="main" key="porri^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrĭgo</orth>, <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype> (contr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">porgo</orth>, <itype>porgite</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 26</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 274</bibl>: <sense id="n37116.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">porge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porgebat, Sil 9, 458: porgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:656" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:755" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 204</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui etiam porgam dixerunt pro porrigam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=218" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 218</bibl></cit> Müll.—Acc. to Lachmann, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 59</bibl>, instead of perditur, we should read porgitur; v. perdo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>por, = pro, and rego</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread out before one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (class.; syn. extendo). </sense><sense id="n37116.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37116.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum, si des, porrexi manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4</bibl></cit>. 7, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">animal membra porrigit, contrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum ad tradendam pyxidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread one's self out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tityos) per tota novem cui jugera corpus Porrigitur,</quote> <trans><tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6</bibl></cit>. 596: <cit><quote lang="la">porrectus somno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens in longam porrigi alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 574</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens centum porrectus in ulnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 153</bibl></cit>; Trogus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 275</bibl>.—So freq. of localities, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum porrigitur in solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (loci) pars colles erant, pars in planitiem porrigebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creta inter ortum occasumque porrigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37116.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37116.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay at full length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch on the ground</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in plenos resolutum carmine somnos, Exanimi similem, stratis porrexit in herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque ab equis ingenti porrigit arvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:553" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spatium ingens ruentem porrexit hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hold forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteram alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium alicui ad occidendum hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 13</bibl>: <cb n="PORR" /> manum sani medicis porrigunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 1</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">maritali porrigere ora capistro,</quote> <trans><tr>to present his head to the marriage halter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.6" n="3" level="3"> Porrigere manum, in voting, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold up the hand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 15</bibl>.—Hence, transf., i. q. <hi rend="ital">to express one's assent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare si tu quoque huic sententiae manum porrigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:15" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37116.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi> (syn. prolato): <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the quantity of a syllable: syllabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquis impetum morbi trahendo effugiat, porrigaturque in id tempus, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be kept alive</tr>, <tr>supported</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.9" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium clientibus porrigere atque tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi forsan, tibi quod negarit, Porriget hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.10" n="C" level="2"> Manus ad (in) aliquid porrigere, <hi rend="ital">to reach after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to obtain</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lydiam cepisti ... jam etiam ad pecora nostra avaras et insatiabiles manus porrigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames me appellat, ad proxima quaeque porrigatur manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Polyb. 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus suas in orientem occidentemque porrexit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mort. Pers. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia deesse coepit, neque quo manus porrigeret suppetebat, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.11" n="D" level="2"> Se porrigere, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam fortuna Romana se ad orientalia regna porrigere coeperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis gradus ulterior, quo se tua porrigat ira, restat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37116.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrecta ac aperta loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba,</quote> <trans><tr>long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mora,</quote> <trans><tr>long</tr>, <tr>protracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: senex, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 6</bibl>; cf. in double sense: tuam amicam video. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Ubi ea'st? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Eccam in tabellis porrectam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrectior acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: porrectior frons, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more cheerful</hi> (opp. contractior), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37116.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessaliae in porrectum longitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37116.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A straight line</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37116.16" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A plain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 17, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37116.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">widespread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famaque et imperī Porrecta majestas ad ortum Solis ab Hesperio cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">porrectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">widely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extensively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi> (post-class.).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrectius ire,</quote> <trans><tr>farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37117" type="main" key="porri_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scurf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dandruff</hi> on the head, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:69" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 27, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl>; 32, 4, 14, § 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 126</bibl>.—Also of other hairy parts of the body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 243" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 243</bibl>.—Of animals, perhaps <hi rend="ital">the mange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porrima: <entryFree id="n37118" type="main" key="Porri^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porrĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess worshipped by women</hi>, perh. another name for Carmentis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:633" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 633</bibl>; cf. Hartung, Rel. d. Röm. 2, p. 199.</sense></entryFree>
porrina: <entryFree id="n37119" type="main" key="porri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porrum</etym>, <sense id="n37119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bed of leeks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porrixo: <entryFree id="n37120" type="hapax" key="porrixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrixo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. porrigo</etym>, <sense id="n37120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out strongly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. Fragm. p. 717</bibl> Oud.</sense></entryFree>
porro: <entryFree id="n37121" type="main" key="porro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porro</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>root pra-; Sanscr. prathamus, primus; Lat. prae, pro, prior; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/rrw, pro/sw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n37121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37121.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space, with verbs both of motion and of rest (rare and mostly anteclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro agere armentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—So ellipt.: porro Quirites, <hi rend="ital">on! hither! ye Romans!</hi> Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl> (al. proh).—With <hi rend="ital">verbs of rest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscius Aeneas, quae sint ea flumina porro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi deinde porro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37121.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37121.3" n="A" level="2"> In time. </sense><sense id="n37121.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aforetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">altera (Nympha), quod porro fuerat, cecinisse putatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:635" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 635</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37121.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Henceforth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in future</hi>: me sollicitum habitum esse atque porro fore, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 190</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in animo Celtiberi haberent aut porro habituri essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, eadem ut sis porro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">move ocius te, ut, quid agam, porro intellegas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: dehinc ut quiescant porro<cb n="PORT" />  moneo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 22: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc maxima porro Accepit Roma, et patrium servavit honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>in aftertimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 600</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37121.6" n="B" level="2"> In a series. </sense><sense id="n37121.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in turn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe audivi a majoribus natu, qui se porro pueros a senibus audisse dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37121.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in discourse. </sense><sense id="n37121.9" n="a" level="4"> In the progress of an argument, or in a sequence of ideas, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furthermore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur porro, nihil deos ignorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 51, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age porro, tu, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Habonium porro intellegebat rem totam esse patefacturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:57:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 57, § 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:240" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:126" default="NO">3, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro autem anxius erat, quid facto opus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fit deinde? porro loquere,</quote> <trans><tr>say on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37121.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro erant qui censerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro si in digito Dei eicio daemonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 10</bibl></cit> (but the true read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 78</bibl>, is paene).</sense></entryFree>
porrum: <entryFree id="n37122" type="main" key="porrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">porrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pra/son</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n37122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scallion;</hi> of two kinds, capitatum and sectile, the latter our <hi rend="ital">chives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:13:18" default="NO">3, 13, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:19" default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:133" default="NO">14, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porsena: <entryFree id="n37123" type="main" key="Porse^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porsĕna</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Porsenna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Por-sina</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who made war on Rome on account of the banished Tarquins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusca Porsĕnae manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 4</bibl></cit>; scanned Porsĕna also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:391" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:480" default="NO">480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:484" default="NO">10, 484</bibl>; 502; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non Tarquinium ejectum Porsenna jubebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 646</bibl></cit> Serv.—Prov.: bona Porsenae vendere, <hi rend="ital">to sell Porsena's goods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to sell goods at auction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porta: <entryFree id="n37124" type="main" key="porta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (portabus for portis, Cn. Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 40</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from root par-, to pierce, pass through; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pera/w, pei/rw, po/ros</foreign>, ford; Lat.: peritus, ex-perior, and v. periculum</etym>, <sense id="n37124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city-gate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (miles) portas frangit, at ille (amans) fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectā portā invadam extemplo in oppidum antiquom et vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Hannibal ad portas venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem portā efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portam praesto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portā introire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressus portā Capenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra portam Collinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta Carmentalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars egressa portis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 60, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 46, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus portis effundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portā Capenā Romam ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 26, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa portis efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portis ruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem portā signa infesta urbi inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefactā portā Romani erumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito omnibus portis eruptione factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus portis prorumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina portarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas obice firmā claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas reserare hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portā triumphali ducere funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctae quoque res, veluti muri et portae, quodammodo divini juris sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi Portas (Carthaginis) non clausas, a proof that the people were fearless,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—Connected with urbis: <cit><quote lang="la">qui urbis portas occuparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum a portis hujus urbis avolsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">per</hi> (rare except in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">per unam portam praesidium Romanum irrumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ante lucem per effractam portam urbem ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aversam portam silentio excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 34, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 46, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 47, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elapsus per eam portam quae ... ad Darii castra pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 34, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fastigio portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 24</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: porta itineri longissima, <hi rend="ital">the way to the gate is the longest</hi> (sc. in making a journey), i. e. <hi rend="ital">it is the first step that costs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37124.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., like our <hi rend="ital">gate</hi>, of <hi rend="ital">an avenue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">door</hi> of any kind (syn.: fores, janua, ostium). —Of the <hi rend="ital">gates</hi> of a camp: <cit><quote lang="la">ab decumanā portā castra munita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">principalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 44, § 157</bibl></cit>: venti, velut agmine facto, Quā data porta, ruunt, <pb n="1401" /> <cb n="PORT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 82</bibl>.—Of a cage: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portā ludis emitti, said of hares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: porta tonat caeli, Enn. ap. Vet. Gram. ap. Col. (Ann. v. 597 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:893" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 893</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">eburna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi portitor aera recepit, Obserat umbrosos lurida porta rogos,</quote> <trans><tr>the portal of the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 8: belli portae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 622</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 61</bibl> (Ann. v. 271 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 38, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae, quae alibi Armeniae, alibi Caspiae, alibi Ciliciae vocantur,</quote> <trans><tr>passes</tr>, <tr>gorges</tr>, <tr>defiles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:496" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 496</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <trans><tr>the signs of Cancer and Aries in the zodiac</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12</bibl></cit>, and S. 1, 17: jecoris, <hi rend="ital">a part of the liver</hi> (so too in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/lh</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the fundament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 17</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n37124.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37124.4" n="A" level="2"> Et quibus e portis occurri cuique deceret, <hi rend="ital">by what way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by what means</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37124.5" n="B" level="2"> As the symbol of strength: <cit><quote lang="la">portae inferi,</quote> <trans><tr>the powers of hell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portabilis: <entryFree id="n37125" type="main" key="porta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>porto</etym>, <sense id="n37125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portable</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus portabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portarius: <entryFree id="n37126" type="main" key="porta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>porta</etym>, <sense id="n37126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Reg. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 16, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portatio: <entryFree id="n37127" type="main" key="porta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porto</etym>, <sense id="n37127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">armorum atque telorum portationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
portatorius: <entryFree id="n37128" type="main" key="porta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for carrying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <trans><tr>a sedan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus portatoriis nubibus ascendens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. Temp. 180, 1</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">portātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. sella), <hi rend="ital">a sedan chair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:161" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portatrix: <entryFree id="n37129" type="gloss" key="porta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that carries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1373</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portella: <entryFree id="n37130" type="gloss" key="portella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porta</etym>, <sense id="n37130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small door</hi>: portella, <foreign lang="greek">r(umopu/lion, parapu/lion</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
portendo: <entryFree id="n37131" type="main" key="portendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n37131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> portendier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>an archaic collat. form in relig. lang. of protendo, to stretch forth</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi> (future events, misfortunes, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portend</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendo, monstro): ea (auspicia) illis exeuntibus in aciem portendisse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 32, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales mihi sacrificanti ... laeta omnia prosperaque portendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudinem imperii portendens prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>: populo commutationem rerum portendit fore, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta annos Cyrum regnaturum esse portendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod portentum regni ruinam portendebat, of an earthquake,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be indicated</hi> (by a sign), <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37131.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Usually of bad fortune, loss, injury, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis periculum magnum portenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspices dudum dicebant mihi, malum damnumque maximum portendier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">malum quod in quiete tibi portentum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in extis nostris portentum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37131.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Of good fortune, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">salvos sum: libertas portenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid spei Latinis portendi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">portentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portent</hi> (syn.: ostentum, prodigium). </sense><sense id="n37131.3" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illa ostenta, monstra, portenta, prodigia dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl> Müll.; and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=244" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 244</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si quod raro fit, id portentum putandum est, sapientem esse portentum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 61</bibl></cit>: portentum inusitatum conflatum est recens, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii portenta atque prodigia nunciabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quaere profecto, Quem casum portenta ferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 533</bibl></cit>.—Of miracles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 34, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 13, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37131.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37131.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A monster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera de genere hoc quae sunt portenta perempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale portentum neque militaris Daunias latis alit aesculetis Nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae virgineo portenta sub inguine latrant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dogs of Scylla</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter naturam hominum pecudumque portentis,</quote> <trans><tr>monstrous births</tr>, <tr>monsters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: bovem quendam putari deum, multaque alia portenta apud <cb n="PORT" /> eosdem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">a monster of depravity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodius, fatale portentum prodigiumque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinius et Piso, duo rei publicae portenta ac paene funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia demens Aegyptus portenta colat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37131.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A marvellous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extravagant fiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a strange tale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wonderful story</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera de genere hoc monstra et portenta locuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum et pictorum portenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portentum atque monstrum certissimum est, esse aliquem humanā specie et figurā, qui tantum immanitate bestias vicerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta atque praestigias scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portentifer: <entryFree id="n37132" type="main" key="portenti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portentĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, v. portentificus.</entryFree>
portentificus: <entryFree id="n37133" type="main" key="portenti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portentĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>portentum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n37133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marvellous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 55</bibl></cit> Jahn (al. portentifera): <cit><quote lang="la">figurae animalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portentosus: <entryFree id="n37134" type="main" key="portento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portentōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tŭōsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>portentum</etym>, <sense id="n37134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of monsters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portentous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolting</hi>, etc. (class., but not used of abstract things till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aliqua portentosa aut ex pecude aut ex homine nata dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer portentoso parvoque capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portentosissima genera ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labyrinthi, vel portentosissimum humani impendii opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of wonderful things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quid fieri portentosius potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio portentosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 114:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 114, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portentum: <entryFree id="n37135" type="main" key="portentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. portendo <sense id="n37135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
portentus: <entryFree id="n37136" type="main" key="portentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from portendo.</entryFree>
porthmeus: <entryFree id="n37137" type="greek" key="Porthmeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porthmeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*porqmeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n37137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ferryman</hi>, a name given to Charon (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">navita Porthmeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 121</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Porthmea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porthmos: <entryFree id="n37138" type="main" key="porthmos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porthmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>,= <foreign lang="greek">porqmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n37138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strait</hi> (pure Lat. fretum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37139" type="main" key="Porthmos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Porthmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porticatio: <entryFree id="n37140" type="main" key="porti^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>porticus</etym>, <sense id="n37140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a row of galleries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">porticoes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porticula: <entryFree id="n37141" type="main" key="porti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small gallery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portico</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1716, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porticuncula: <entryFree id="n37142" type="gloss" key="porti^cuncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭcuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small gallery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4821</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
porticus: <entryFree id="n37143" type="main" key="porti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also heteroclit. <sense id="n37143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> PORTICOS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4043</bibl>) [porta], <hi rend="ital">a walk covered by a roof supported on columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colonnade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piazza</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arcade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portico</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">stoa/</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n37143.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes porticus commetiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum aedificare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inambulare in porticu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae latae, porticus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticuum laxitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amplis porticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 353</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 528</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me porticus excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus, in quā gestetur dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 42, 3</bibl></cit>.—In the upper story, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37143.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n37143.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The entrance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">porch</hi> of a tent (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): saucii opplent porticus, <hi rend="ital">the porches</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37143.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A weather-board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9 praef.</bibl> § 2; 9, 7, 4; 9, 14, 14.—</sense><sense id="n37143.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A long shed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gallery</hi> to protect soldiers in sieges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37143.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Porch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Portico</hi>, meaning <hi rend="ital">the school of the Stoics</hi> (from <foreign lang="greek">stoa/</foreign>, porch, the place where Zeno taught); hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">the Stoic philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Stoics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippus, qui fulcire putatur porticum Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 44</bibl>: clamat Zeno et tota illa porticus tumultuatur, Cic. Fragm. ap. Aug. contr. Ac. 3, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portio: <entryFree id="n37144" type="main" key="porti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<sense id="n37144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> portioni, Inscr. Lat. 206, 38), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with pars and <foreign lang="greek">po/rw</foreign>, to share, impart</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portion</hi> (post-Aug., except in the phrase pro portione; v. in foll. II.). </sense><sense id="n37144.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Luna aequā portione divisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 42</bibl></cit>: ex his portio in Italiā consedit, portio in Illyricos<cb n="PORT" />  sinus penetravit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 36, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis quota portio faecis Achaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox in proflatum additur tertia portio aeris collectanei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari portione inter se mixta pix, cera, alumen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">glandis cortex et nitrum paribus portionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil natura portionibus parit,</quote> <trans><tr>by parts</tr>, <tr>piecemeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portio brevissima vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars A carnaniae, quam in portionem belli acceperat,</quote> <trans><tr>as his share for his services in the war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare aliquem in portionem muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna mortalium portio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37144.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a relation</hi> to any thing, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, i. q. proportio.—</sense><sense id="n37144.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., adverb. </sense><sense id="n37144.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō portiōne</orth> (class.; not in Cæs.), <hi rend="ital">in proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportionally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relatively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro portione ea omnia facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro portione ad majorem fundum vel minorem addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertinis pro portione imperaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportet ut aedibus ac templis vestibula et aditus, sic causis principia pro portione rerum praeponere,</quote> <trans><tr>in relation</tr>, <tr>in proportion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro ratā portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro suā scilicet portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37144.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭōne</orth> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum omnia habent animalia, quae sanguinem: sed homo portione maximum,</quote> <trans><tr>proportionally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 133</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 70, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 2, 1, § 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac portione mediocribus agris semina praebenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quādam portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37144.6" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ad portiō-nem</orth> (rare and only post Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 8, 30, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suam quisque portionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra portionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37144.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem ad decem homines servabitur portio,</quote> <trans><tr>the same proportion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portionem servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:87" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proportione servatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
